question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Coca-Cola not recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola does not announce a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If such a recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola issue a recall for any items because of metal contamination before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola makes a public announcement regarding the recall of any of its items due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially verified by Coca-Cola or an appropriate food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically pertain to metal substances present in the food products. If no such recall takes place within the designated timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Danone recall any products due to metal contamination and Coca-Cola not recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Danone announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Danone or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. (b) Coca-Cola does not announce a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. If no recall by Coca-Cola occurs within the specified timeframe, this condition is satisfied. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Danone not recall any products due to metal contamination or Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Danone does not announce a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. If a recall by Danone occurs within the specified timeframe, this condition is not satisfied. (b) Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will Danone have to recall any products because of metal contamination while Coca-Cola does not recall any products for the same reason?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) Danone issues a recall for any of its products due to metal contamination. This recall must be officially announced by Danone or a pertinent food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically relate to metal substances present in the food items. (b) Coca-Cola does not issue a recall for any of its products regarding metal contamination. If Coca-Cola does not announce a recall within the designated timeframe, this condition is considered met. If both criteria are satisfied, the question will be answered as YES; otherwise, it will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will either Coca-Cola or Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, either Coca-Cola or Danone announces a recall of any of their products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs for either company within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Coca-Cola nor Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, neither Coca-Cola nor Danone announces a recall of any of their products due to metal contamination. The recall must not be officially confirmed by either company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and not reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must not specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If such a recall occurs for either company within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Coca-Cola or Danone issue a product recall because of metal contamination before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, either Coca-Cola or Danone makes an announcement regarding the recall of any of their products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially verified by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a pertinent food safety authority (like the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically pertain to metal substances present in the food items. If neither company executes such a recall within the designated period, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Union Pacific not implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad does not announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must not be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must not be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If such a system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is Union Pacific set to roll out a new scheduling system for freight train operations before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad reveals and puts into action a new scheduling system designed to enhance the predictability of freight train operation schedules. Confirmation of the implementation must come from official statements from the company or coverage by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). The new system must be specifically crafted to tackle the quality of life issues related to the predictability of freight train schedules. If such a system is not implemented and verified by the resolution deadline, or if the system that is implemented does not specifically focus on improving schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific reaches a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability, and (b) Union Pacific fails to implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (a) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. This agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors. (b) Union Pacific does not announce or implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The lack of implementation must be confirmed through the absence of official company statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Alternatively, if a new system is implemented but it does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will also resolve as YES. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific does not reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability, or (b) Union Pacific implements a new scheduling system for freight train operations?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors do not publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. This agreement must not be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should not directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors. (b) Union Pacific does announce or implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Alternatively, if a new system is implemented and it specifically targets schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will also resolve as NO. If both condition (a) and condition (b) are met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a new agreement is reached between Union Pacific and the conductors' union that addresses the predictability of work schedules, and (b) a new scheduling system for freight train operations is not put into effect by Union Pacific?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors make a public announcement of a new agreement that explicitly deals with the predictability of work schedules for conductors. This agreement must be officially acknowledged by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or significant national newspapers). The agreement should specifically tackle the issue of enhancing the predictability of schedules for train conductors. (b) Union Pacific does not disclose or execute a new scheduling system designed to improve the predictability of freight train operations. The absence of implementation must be verified through the lack of official statements from the company or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Alternatively, if a new system is introduced but it does not specifically aim to enhance schedule predictability for freight train operations, the inquiry will also be answered with YES. If either condition (a) or (b) is not fulfilled by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations or reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. (b) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Union Pacific not implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations or not reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. (b) Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If either (a) or (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will Union Pacific either introduce a new freight train scheduling system or establish a new agreement with the conductors' union that improves work schedule predictability?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if one of the following happens by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad reveals and puts into action a new scheduling system aimed at enhancing the predictability of freight train operations. This implementation must be validated through official statements from the company or reported by a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The new system should be specifically tailored to address the quality of life issues concerning schedule predictability for freight train operations. (b) Union Pacific and the union that represents train conductors publicly declare a new agreement that focuses on improving work schedule predictability for conductors. This agreement must be officially acknowledged by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or leading national newspapers). The agreement should specifically tackle the matter of enhancing the predictability of schedules for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing dispute. If neither (a) nor (b) takes place by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Pennsylvania not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Pennsylvania to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania carries out a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be made publicly available through official state communications or well-known news outlets.

If no such vote fulfilling these criteria takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually holding it by the specified date does not count for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024 (b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: No referendum officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania by the specified date, no referendum with the primary focus on abortion rights protection occurs by the specified date, and no referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources by the specified date. If such a referendum meeting these criteria does occur by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024 (b) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Tennessee does not enact new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: A referendum officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania by the specified date, a referendum with the primary focus on abortion rights protection occurs by the specified date, and referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources by the specified date. If no such referendum meeting these criteria does occur by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES if either (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Tennessee implements new abortion rules that are more stringent than those for other medical providers by July 2024 (b) Pennsylvania refrains from holding a vote on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following conditions are satisfied: 

(a) Tennessee puts into effect new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose more rigorous requirements on abortion providers compared to other medical providers. The implementation must be verified by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two credible news outlets. More rigorous requirements may involve additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specifically for abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply uniformly to all medical providers, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not hold a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be fulfilled: No vote officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania by the specified date, no vote primarily focused on abortion rights protection occurs by the specified date, and no vote results are publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely recognized news outlets by the specified date. If such a vote meeting these criteria does occur by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will either Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, or Tennessee enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The criteria for a YES resolution include:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO for this part.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO for this part.

The overall question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) occurs by their respective deadlines.

not_P.title: Will neither Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, nor Tennessee enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. The criteria for a NO resolution include:
   1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as YES for this part.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must not be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as YES for this part.

The overall question resolves as YES if neither (a) nor (b) occurs by their respective deadlines.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Pennsylvania will hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024, or that Tennessee will implement more stringent abortion regulations by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if one of the following takes place:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. The criteria for an affirmative resolution include:
   1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The main objective of the vote must revolve around the safeguarding of abortion rights.
   3. The outcomes of the vote must be disclosed through official state channels or widely recognized media outlets.
   If no such vote that meets these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as negative.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee adopts new laws or regulations that enforce stricter conditions on abortion service providers compared to other medical service providers. The implementation must be validated by official state legislative records or reported by at least two credible news organizations. Stricter conditions may encompass, but are not confined to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards that are specific to abortion service providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the specified resolution date, or if any laws or regulations enacted apply uniformly to all medical service providers, this part of the question will resolve as negative.

The overall inquiry will be affirmed if either (a) or (b) occurs by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Google's AI assistant not be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be credible reports of Google's AI assistant disseminating misinformation regarding elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, credible reports or official alerts from election officials, government entities, or trusted news organizations indicate that Google's AI assistant is disseminating misinformation related to elections. For this question, 'election misinformation' is defined as inaccurate or misleading information concerning election procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Credible reports must originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US television networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The reports or alerts must specifically reference the AI assistant's involvement in the spread of election misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are made by the resolution date, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The CMA announces completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation by July 2024, and (2) Google's AI assistant is not reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body:
This combined question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this part resolves as NO.

2. By August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part resolves as YES.

The overall question resolves as YES if both conditions are satisfied.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) The CMA announces completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation by July 2024, nor (2) Google's AI assistant is reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This combined question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is completed, this part resolves as YES.

2. By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES if neither condition is satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) The CMA will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into digital advertising practices by July 2024, and (2) there will be no reports of Google's AI assistant disseminating election misinformation by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This combined inquiry will result in a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. By July 31, 2024, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) officially states that its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major firms has concluded. This conclusion must be verified through an official announcement from the CMA or reported by at least two leading news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA fails to announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, this part will resolve as NO.

2. By August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official alerts from election officials, governmental bodies, or trustworthy news outlets indicating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information regarding election processes, candidates, or outcomes. Credible reports should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in respected journals. The reports or alerts must specifically reference the AI assistant and its involvement in disseminating election misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are issued by the resolution date, this part will resolve as YES.

The overall inquiry will resolve as YES if both criteria are met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation, or (b) the CMA announce completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation, nor (b) the CMA announce completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation?

For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. No credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must not specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK does not officially announce the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must not be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

If either of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by their designated deadlines, either (a) there will be credible reports of Google's AI assistant disseminating false information regarding elections, or (b) the CMA will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into digital advertising practices?
para_P.body:

'False information about elections' refers to inaccurate or misleading details concerning electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Credible evidence should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in reputable journals. The evidence or alerts must specifically refer to the AI assistant and its involvement in spreading false electoral information.

If neither of these occurrences takes place by their respective deadlines, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Indiana not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana holds a public vote aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative resolution, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and carried out by the state of Indiana.
2. The main emphasis of the public vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

If no such public vote fulfilling these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without its execution by the specified date does not qualify for an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Colorado enacts a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024, and (b) Indiana refrains from conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the state of Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Colorado news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Indiana does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met: 1. No referendum is officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana by the specified date. 2. There is no public referendum with the primary focus on abortion rights protection. 3. There are no publicly reported results of such a referendum by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as YES. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date qualifies for a YES resolution.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are satisfied by their respective deadlines. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

2. No press release from Land O'Frost
3. No announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. No reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must not explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If a recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will no other U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan without a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must not be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must not be officially adopted, but merely proposed or under consideration. If at least one other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024, and (b) no other U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. The question will resolve as YES if either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Illinois not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?

The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if such a referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must not be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Illinois to conduct a public vote on healthcare reform before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Illinois officially carries out a public vote specifically aimed at implementing healthcare reform in the state. The vote must be formally declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority and should be set to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the vote must directly relate to healthcare reform. This inquiry will be considered negative if no such vote is officially declared or executed by the designated date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a possible vote does not meet the criteria for an affirmative resolution; the actual vote must be planned or conducted within the specified period.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Pennsylvania holds a referendum on renewable energy initiatives and (b) Illinois does not hold a referendum on healthcare reform?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives. For this condition to be met:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
   - The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. Illinois does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform. For this condition to be met:
   - No referendum on healthcare reform is officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority.
   - No such referendum is scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024.
   - The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

If at least one condition is met, the question resolves as YES. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) California holds a referendum on gun control measures and (b) Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate at a rally in New York City?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location. The announcement must not be made by Harris herself during the rally, or it must fail to clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. If Harris makes such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, and the event and announcement are confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company not be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has not fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must not be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must not be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Full relocations or plans completed by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides in favor of the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a prominent cybersecurity firm's main office be entirely moved to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a prominent cybersecurity firm has completely shifted its main office from its original site to Austin, Texas. For a YES resolution to occur:

1. The move must be officially declared by the firm or its executives.
2. The declaration must be covered by at least two major, credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new main office must be operational in Austin, Texas, with essential executive functions transferred.

Any partial moves or plans still underway by July 31, 2024, will not suffice for a YES resolution. If the relocation is not finalized and functioning by this date, or if the firm opts against the move, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google will face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024, and (b) No major cybersecurity company will fully relocate its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, this condition is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For this condition to be met:
1. No official announcement of a completed relocation by any major cybersecurity company or its leadership is made.
2. Such an announcement is not reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters is not operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions not transferred.
Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will be sufficient for this condition to be met. If the move is completed and operational by this date, this condition is not met.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Google will not face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024, or (b) At least one major cybersecurity company will fully relocate its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Google does not become subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. This means that there are no new legal actions officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, this condition is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, at least one major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For this condition to be met:
1. An official announcement of a completed relocation by at least one major cybersecurity company or its leadership is made.
2. Such an announcement is reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters is operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.
If the move is completed and operational by this date, this condition is met.

If at least one condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body:

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) Construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the condition is not met. (2) Google does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce. If Google only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, or if no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, this condition is met. question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the UK economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is characterized, for the purposes of this question, as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Office for National Statistics in the UK. Conversely, the answer will be negative if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) General Motors' quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year for any quarter, and (b) the UK economy enters a recession?

If either condition is not met, this question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points (b) The Central Bank of New Zealand does not announce a new economic stimulus package?

Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.
