(b) At any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index reaches 3,500 points during this period, this component resolves as YES. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points. If both components resolve as NO, the combined question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand will declare a new economic stimulus package, or that South Korea's KOSPI index will hit or surpass 3,500 points?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with a YES if one of the following happens: (a) The Central Bank of New Zealand makes an official announcement of a new economic stimulus package by August 31, 2024. This announcement must come through a recognized communication channel of the Central Bank of New Zealand, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor. The announcement should clearly outline the new economic stimulus package and must be reported by at least two significant financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such announcement is made by the deadline or if the Central Bank of New Zealand continues its existing economic policy, this part resolves as NO. (b) Between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index achieves or exceeds the 3,500 points threshold. The 3,500 points is selected as a significant level that the index may have reached prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official index data from credible financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this timeframe, this part resolves as NO. Note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not have to close at or above 3,500 points. If either part resolves as YES, then the overall question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

not_P.title: Will the U.S. government not resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has not officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The lack of resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The lack of resumption should involve no active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If such a resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration is lifted, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the rejection of any specific projects, only the non-resumption of the consideration process.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. administration restart evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal administration has formally restarted the evaluation of initiatives aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The restart must be verified through official announcements from the government or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The restart should involve the active processing or assessment of LNG export project applications by the appropriate federal agencies. If such a restart does not occur by the resolution date, or if the halt on evaluation remains in place, the question will be answered as NO. It is important to note that this question does not necessitate the approval of any particular projects, only the resumption of the evaluation process.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, and (b) the U.S. government does not resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), and (b) the U.S. federal government has not officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG), confirmed through the absence of official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur by July 2024: (a) BYD's quarterly net income does not increase by over 20% year-over-year, or (b) the U.S. government resumes consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: (a) BYD reports a net income increase of 20% or less for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), or (b) the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG), confirmed through the presence of official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). If both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place by July 2024: (a) BYD's quarterly net earnings rise by more than 20% compared to the previous year, and (b) the U.S. government does not restart the evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) BYD announces a net earnings growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter from the prior year, as verified by official company earnings disclosures or at least three reliable financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), and (b) the U.S. federal government has not officially recommenced the review of projects related to the export of liquefied natural gas (LNG), confirmed by the lack of official government statements or reports from at least two trustworthy news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the U.S. government resumes consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects, OR (b) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The U.S. federal government officially resumes the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). This resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal), involving the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. (b) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If neither of these conditions is met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the U.S. government resumes consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects, NOR (b) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The U.S. federal government officially resumes the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). This resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal), involving the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. (b) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If either of these conditions is met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that by July 2024, either (a) the U.S. government will restart its evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives, or (b) BYD's quarterly net earnings will rise by over 20% compared to the same quarter from the previous year?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, one of the following takes place: (a) The U.S. federal government officially resumes its evaluation of liquefied natural gas (LNG) export initiatives. This must be substantiated by official government communications or reports from at least two reliable news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal), indicating active processing or assessment of LNG export project applications by the pertinent federal agencies. (b) BYD discloses a net income growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter of the previous year, in its official financial disclosures released by July 31, 2024. This growth must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or at least three trustworthy financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If neither of these scenarios occurs by the resolution date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for train engineers operating in Texas. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for train engineers in Texas. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for engineers in Texas, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Union Pacific not implement a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad does not announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for train engineers operating in Texas. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must not be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for train engineers in Texas. If such a system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system specifically targets schedule predictability for engineers in Texas, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is Union Pacific going to introduce a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad declares and puts into action a new scheduling system designed to enhance the predictability of schedules for train engineers working in Texas. The implementation must be verified through official company announcements or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system should be explicitly created to tackle the quality of life issues linked to schedule predictability for train engineers in Texas. If such a system is not implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the introduced system does not specifically focus on schedule predictability for engineers in Texas, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific implements a new scheduling system for passenger train services, and (b) Union Pacific does not implement a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for passenger train services, confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers), and specifically designed to address quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for passenger train services; and (b) Union Pacific Railroad does not announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for train engineers operating in Texas, confirmed through official company statements or the absence of reports by at least two reputable news sources. If both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific implements a new scheduling system for passenger train services, nor (b) Union Pacific implements a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for passenger train services, confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers), and specifically designed to address quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for passenger train services; and (b) Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for train engineers operating in Texas, confirmed through official company statements or the absence of reports by at least two reputable news sources. If either condition is met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Union Pacific introduces a new scheduling system for passenger train operations, and (b) Union Pacific refrains from introducing a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the following criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) Union Pacific Railroad declares and puts into effect a new scheduling system designed to enhance predictability for passenger train operations, as verified by official communications from the company or coverage by at least two credible news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers), specifically aimed at tackling quality of life issues concerning schedule predictability for passenger train services; and (b) Union Pacific Railroad does not declare or implement a new scheduling system intended to improve predictability for train engineers working in Texas, as verified by official communications from the company or the lack of reports from at least two credible news sources. If either of these conditions fails to be satisfied, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for either train engineers in Texas or passenger train services by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for either train engineers operating in Texas or for passenger train services. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for either engineers in Texas or passenger train services. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for either of these groups, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Union Pacific not implement a new scheduling system for either train engineers in Texas or passenger train services by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad does not announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for either train engineers operating in Texas or for passenger train services. The implementation must not be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must not be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for either engineers in Texas or passenger train services. If such a system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system specifically targets schedule predictability for either of these groups, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will Union Pacific introduce a new scheduling system for train engineers in Texas or for passenger train services?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and puts into action a new scheduling system designed to enhance schedule predictability for either train engineers working in Texas or for passenger train services. The implementation must be verified through official statements from the company or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must specifically focus on addressing the quality of life issues related to schedule predictability for either engineers in Texas or passenger train services. If no such system is confirmed and implemented by the resolution date, or if the system that is implemented does not specifically aim at improving schedule predictability for either of these groups, the question will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Pennsylvania not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Pennsylvania to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES determination, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary objective of the vote must center around the safeguarding of abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed through official state channels or well-known news outlets.

If no such vote fulfilling these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually carrying it out by the given date does not meet the criteria for a YES determination.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024 AND will Pennsylvania not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. This must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (2) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This means no referendum is officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, the primary focus of any conducted referendum is not on abortion rights protection, and no referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Missouri not remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024 OR will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occur: (1) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri does not officially announce the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. This must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (2) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This means a referendum is officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, the primary focus of any conducted referendum is on abortion rights protection, and referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If either condition is met, the question resolves as YES. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that Missouri will eliminate the work requirement from its Medicaid program by July 2024 AND that Pennsylvania will refrain from holding a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if both of the following take place: (1) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri makes an official declaration regarding the elimination of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This must be verified through official announcements from the state or reported by at least two prominent news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries must engage in work or other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (2) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania does not carry out a public referendum specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. This entails that no referendum is officially declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania, the main focus of any conducted referendum is not on the protection of abortion rights, and no referendum results are released by official state channels or widely recognized news organizations. If both criteria are satisfied, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either criterion is unmet, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 or Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, this part of the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 nor Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as YES.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed, this part of the question resolves as YES.

The overall question resolves as YES if both (a) and (b) resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Pennsylvania will hold a referendum on abortion rights before August 2024, or that Missouri will eliminate the work requirement from its Medicaid program by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following events occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:
1. The vote must be officially initiated and carried out by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main objective of the vote must be to safeguard abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be disclosed through official state channels or reputable news outlets.
If no such vote that meets these criteria takes place by August 31, 2024, this segment of the question will be answered as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Missouri officially declares the elimination of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This change must be validated through official state communications or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the stipulation that beneficiaries must work or participate in other qualifying activities to obtain Medicaid benefits. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement continues to be enforced, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

The overall inquiry will be answered with YES if either (a) or (b) is answered with YES.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. A such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will Georgia conduct a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative conclusion:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and executed by the Georgia state authorities.
2. The public vote must specifically tackle the matter of abortion rights protections.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed by official state sources or widely recognized media outlets.

The inquiry will be considered negative if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is canceled or delayed past the given date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically concentrate on establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the results of the public vote, only whether it is conducted within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the FTC announces completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024, and (b) Georgia does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Georgia does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The referendum is officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum explicitly addresses the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

This combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

not_P.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the FTC does not announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024, or (b) Georgia holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) does not officially announce the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC announces the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this part resolves as YES.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. Such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   The question will resolve as YES if:
   1. The referendum is officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum explicitly addresses the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

This combined question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) occurs as described.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the FTC declares the conclusion of a significant investigation into pricing practices by July 2024, and (b) Georgia refrains from holding a public vote on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) makes an official announcement regarding the completion of its inquiry into pricing strategies that utilize personal information to determine prices based on individual consumer traits. The inquiry must involve a minimum of five major corporations. The conclusion must be validated through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC fails to announce the completion of such an inquiry by this deadline, or if the inquiry is still in progress, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Georgia does not officially carry out a public referendum that specifically aims to establish protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. No such referendum takes place by August 31, 2024.
   2. Any planned referendum is either cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum occurs, but it does not specifically aim to establish protections for abortion rights.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The referendum is officially announced and executed by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum directly addresses the matter of abortion rights protection.
   3. The outcomes of the referendum are publicly reported by official state sources or widely recognized news outlets.

This combined question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as outlined.

question.title: Will either Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, or the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

1. Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   - It must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics by July 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The investigation must involve at least five major companies.
   - Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

If neither of these events occurs within their respective timeframes, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, nor the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs:

1. Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   - It must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics by July 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES:
   - The investigation must not involve at least five major companies.
   - Completion must not be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

If either of these events occurs within their respective timeframes, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Georgia will conduct a vote on abortion rights by August 2024, or that the FTC will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into pricing practices by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as YES if one of the following takes place:

1. Georgia formally carries out a public vote aimed at securing protections for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. For this to be marked as YES:
   - The vote must be officially declared and executed by the Georgia state authorities.
   - It must directly tackle the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
   - The outcomes must be disclosed by official state channels or widely acknowledged news outlets.

2. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially states that it has completed its investigation into pricing practices that utilize personal data to determine prices based on individual shopper characteristics by July 31, 2024. For this to be marked as YES:
   - The investigation must include at least five prominent companies.
   - Confirmation of completion must come from an official FTC statement or be reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

If neither of these events occurs within their specified deadlines, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

not_P.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage not exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not exceed 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate exceeds 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the mean interest rate for a 15-year mortgage surpass 5.5% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, at any time in August 2024, the mean interest rate for a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 5.5%. The interest rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the interest rate does not exceed 5.5% at any moment during August 2024, the resolution will be NO. To clarify, the rate must exceed 5.5%, not just match it.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024 and (b) the average rate on a 15-year mortgage not exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. (b) At no point during August 2024 does the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceed 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate exceeds 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 5.5%, it can be equal to or less than 5.5%. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024 nor (b) the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. (b) At any point during August 2024 does the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceed 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate is equal to or less than 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) by July 2024, PepsiCo will announce a rise in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand, and (b) the average interest rate on a 15-year mortgage will not go above 5.5% by August 2024?

If the rate goes beyond 5.5% at any time during August 2024, this condition is not fulfilled. For clarity, the rate must remain at or below 5.5%. If both stipulations are fulfilled, the question resolves as YES. If either or both stipulations are unmet, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If such a bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the House of Lords in the United Kingdom enact a significant economic reform legislation that is opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the House of Lords in the United Kingdom enacts a significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his government. To be considered:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, including fiscal expenditures, taxation, or monetary matters.
2. It must be enacted by the House of Lords, regardless of its subsequent legal status.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his government must be distinctly reported by at least two prominent international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets regarding its potential effects on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is enacted by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is enacted but fails to satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Apple finalizes a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024, and (b) the UK's House of Lords fails to pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:
   1. No bill related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, is passed by the House of Lords.
   2. If any bill is passed, it must not meet one or more of the following criteria:
      - It is not explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Sunak or his administration, as reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
      - It is not described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as YES.

The question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are true. If either one or both are false, it resolves as NO.

If at least one such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as YES.

The question resolves as YES if at least one of (a) or (b) is true. If both are false, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

not_P.title: Will the Bank of England not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself does not occur by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if the Bank of England makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. If no such declaration is issued by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be considered FALSE. It is important to note that the actual date of implementing the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for the Bank of England's monetary policy.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) GNC Holdings emerges from bankruptcy by July 2024 and (b) the Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings, confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets or through official company statements or court documents, involving a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. (b) The Bank of England does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. If either GNC Holdings fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date or the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) GNC Holdings fails to emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024 or (b) the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024?

(b) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If both GNC Holdings officially emerges from bankruptcy by the specified date and the Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) GNC Holdings will successfully exit bankruptcy by July 2024 and (b) the Bank of England will refrain from declaring an interest rate reduction by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Italian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Italian economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?

A recession is characterized for this question as two back-to-back quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Italian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% and (b) The Italian economy enters a recession?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame. (b) This question resolves as YES if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Elon Musk not conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
not_P.body:

1. The interview must not be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must not be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must not be the interviewee.
4. The event must not be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must not be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. Less than two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does occur, the question resolves as NO.

If all these criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If any of these conditions are unmet by that date, or if the conversation does not take place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles, and (b) Elon Musk does not conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

(b) Elon Musk does not conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter). For a positive resolution of this condition, any of the following criteria must be met:
   1. The interview is not conducted live on the X platform.
   2. Elon Musk is not the primary interviewer.
   3. Sergey Brin is not the interviewee.
   4. The event is not officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   5. The interview is not publicly accessible on the X platform.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate reduction can occur after August 31, 2024, as long as the declaration itself is made by that date. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) India eliminates export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024, and (b) the Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

Partial reductions or eliminations on only some products do not suffice. question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Nvidia announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024 and (2) Elon Musk not conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?

2. Elon Musk does not conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, any of the following criteria must be met:

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Uber lays off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, and (b) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure never shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 

(a) Uber confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

(b) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure does not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The absence of such an increase must be confirmed by the lack of official publications by the Reserve Bank of India or any relevant Indian government agency and not reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If any such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Astellas allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Mexican economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Mexico's economy steer clear of a recession by the end of July 2024?

For the purpose of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The inquiry is answered with a NO if the Mexican economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike and (b) the Mexican economy enters a recession?
question.body:
(a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike: This occurs if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 workers, last at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from Sony Corporation and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

(b) The Mexican economy enters a recession: This occurs if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Sony Corporation does not resolve a major workers' strike nor (b) the Mexican economy does not enter a recession?
not_P.body:

The strike must involve at least 1,000 workers, last at least one week, and the resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from Sony Corporation and the union, and not reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

(b) The Mexican economy does not enter a recession: This occurs if the Mexican economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a significant workers' strike at Sony Corporation is resolved and (b) the economy of Mexico falls into a recession?

The strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 workers, persist for at least one week, and the resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the union, along with coverage from at least two credible international news outlets.

(b) The economy of Mexico falls into a recession: This occurs if the Mexican economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Mexican economy avoids a recession or (b) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Mexican economy does not enter a recession. This means there are no two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

(b) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 Sony Corporation workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as YES. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

If neither condition (a) nor (b) is met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, one of the following happens: (a) The Mexican economy successfully avoids a recession or (b) Sony Corporation comes to a resolution regarding a significant workers' strike?

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Central Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the European Central Bank will declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the European Central Bank makes an official declaration of a reduction in its primary refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the ECB or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the ECB's Governing Council and conveyed in their official statement or press conference after a meeting.
