question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Google resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 and (b) the United Food and Commercial Workers not endorse any candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

1. Google resolves a major workers' strike by reaching an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

2. The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) does not publicly endorse any candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. This will be based on the absence of official UFCW statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal) confirming an endorsement.

If both conditions are met by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Google does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024 or (b) the United Food and Commercial Workers endorse any candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is not met by July 31, 2024:

1. Google does not resolve a major workers' strike by reaching an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union, and not reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

2. The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorses at least one candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. This will be based on the presence of official UFCW statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal) confirming an endorsement.

If at least one of these conditions is not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Google successfully concludes a significant workers' strike by July 2024 and (b) the United Food and Commercial Workers refrains from endorsing any candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024:

1. Google successfully ends a significant workers' strike by coming to an agreement with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a substantial strike. The strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 participants and persist for no less than one week. The resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Google and the involved union, and reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

2. The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) does not make any public endorsements for a candidate in the 2024 United States presidential election. This determination will rely on the lack of official UFCW statements or reports from at least two reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal) confirming any endorsement.

If both criteria are satisfied by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either or both criteria are not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The United Food and Commercial Workers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, or (b) Google resolve a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorse a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The United Food and Commercial Workers not endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, nor (b) Google not resolve a major workers' strike?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorse a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If such an endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) The United Food and Commercial Workers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, or (b) Google come to a resolution regarding a major workers' strike?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if either of the following happens by July 31, 2024:

(a) The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly supports a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be verified through official UFCW communications or reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement should clearly express backing for a particular candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly disclosed by the resolution date, the question will be answered as NO. It is important to note that this question does not take into account hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only formal, public endorsements will be deemed valid for resolution.

(b) Google comes to a settlement with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a significant strike. For the resolution to be recognized as valid:
   1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Google employees (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must continue for a minimum of one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official announcements from both Google and the participating union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution meeting all of these criteria is reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If no such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) does not announce new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The absence of such an announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). Any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, must remain unchanged and must not directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If any new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the RBI implement additional restrictions on Yes Bank's lending activities before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) declares new restrictions specifically aimed at Yes Bank's lending operations. The declaration must be validated by official communications from the RBI or reported by at least two prominent Indian financial news sources (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new restrictions should be separate from any current regulations in place as of October 1, 2023, and must have a direct effect on Yes Bank's lending practices. If no new restrictions are announced by the given date, or if any announced restrictions do not specifically address Yes Bank's lending activities, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Food and Agriculture Organization announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024, and (b) The Reserve Bank of India refrain from imposing new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) does not announce any new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. This includes the absence of any official statements from the RBI or reports by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard) confirming such curbs. If no new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, this part resolves as YES. If new curbs are announced and confirmed, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES. If either part resolves as NO, the overall question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Food and Agriculture Organization announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024, nor (b) The Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must not be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, this part resolves as YES.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. This includes the presence of official statements from the RBI or reports by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard) confirming such curbs. If no new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if neither (a) nor (b) resolves as YES. If either part resolves as YES, the overall question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events expected to take place: (a) The Food and Agriculture Organization will declare new funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024, and (b) The Reserve Bank of India will not impose additional regulatory restrictions on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
para_P.body:

The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (like their website or press releases) and be covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must represent new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not extensions of previously disclosed commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) does not declare any new regulatory restrictions specifically aimed at Yes Bank's lending activities. This includes the lack of any official communications from the RBI or confirmations from at least two prominent Indian financial news organizations (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard) regarding such restrictions. If no new restrictions are announced by the specified date, or if any announced restrictions do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending activities, this part resolves as YES. If new restrictions are announced and confirmed, this part resolves as NO.

The overall inquiry resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES. If either part resolves as NO, the overall inquiry resolves as NO.

If neither condition is satisfied by their respective deadlines, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will New York not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. Such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held that specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will New York conduct a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially carries out a public vote aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and executed by the New York state authorities.
2. The public vote must directly address the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or widely recognized media outlets.

The inquiry will be considered negative if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is canceled or delayed beyond the given date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically focus on establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the result of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Georgia holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 (b) New York does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Georgia officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution by July 31, 2024. The referendum must be formally announced by the Georgia state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Georgia-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Georgia and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will be considered not met.

(b) New York does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. This condition will be met if:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   
This question will resolve as NO if either Georgia does not hold the specified referendum by July 31, 2024, or New York does hold such a referendum by August 31, 2024, or both conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Georgia does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 (b) New York holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: 

(a) Georgia does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution by July 31, 2024. This condition will be met if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024.

(b) New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. This condition will be met if:
   1. Such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held that specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   
This question will resolve as NO if both Georgia holds the specified referendum by July 31, 2024, and New York does not hold such a referendum by August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will both of the following happen: (a) Georgia conducts a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 (b) New York refrains from holding a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as YES if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied: 

(a) Georgia officially carries out a statewide referendum specifically regarding the establishment of abortion rights in the state constitution by July 31, 2024. The referendum must be officially declared by the Georgia state government and confirmed by at least two major news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or prominent news outlets based in Georgia). The referendum must be accessible to all eligible voters in Georgia and concentrate primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum does not take place or is not finalized by the resolution date, or if it is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will be deemed unmet.

(b) New York does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically aimed at establishing protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. This condition will be fulfilled if:

This inquiry will be resolved as NO if either Georgia fails to hold the specified referendum by July 31, 2024, or New York holds such a referendum by August 31, 2024, or if both conditions are not satisfied.

question.title: Will either New York or Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.

   - The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Georgia and focus primarily on abortion rights.

The question will resolve as NO if neither of these referendums occurs by their respective deadlines, or if any planned referendum is canceled or postponed beyond the specified dates.

not_P.title: Will neither New York nor Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

The question will resolve as NO if either of these referendums occurs by their respective deadlines, or if any planned referendum is canceled or postponed beyond the specified dates.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that a referendum regarding abortion rights will take place in either New York or Georgia before August 2024?

The question will be deemed NO if neither of these referendums is held by their deadlines, or if any scheduled referendum is canceled or postponed past the specified dates.

question.title: Will Washington's Medicaid expansion program enroll over 450,000 people by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if Washington's Medicaid expansion program has enrolled more than 450,000 residents by July 31, 2024. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the enrollment does not exceed 450,000 by the resolution date, or if reliable data is not available, the question resolves as NO. The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid.

not_P.title: Will Washington's Medicaid expansion program enroll 450,000 people or fewer by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if Washington's Medicaid expansion program has enrolled 450,000 residents or fewer by July 31, 2024. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the enrollment does exceed 450,000 by the resolution date, or if reliable data is not available, the question resolves as NO. The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Washington's Medicaid expansion initiative will have more than 450,000 enrollees by July 2024?

Should the enrollment fall short of 450,000 by the specified resolution date, or if trustworthy data is not accessible, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. The enrollment figure refers to the total count of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion initiative, excluding those who were already eligible for Medicaid.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of Australia announces an interest rate cut and (b) Washington's Medicaid expansion program enrolls 450,000 people or fewer?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. (b) Washington's Medicaid expansion program has enrolled 450,000 residents or fewer. The enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of Australia announces an interest rate cut nor (b) Washington's Medicaid expansion program enrolls 450,000 people or fewer?

(b) Washington's Medicaid expansion program has not enrolled 450,000 residents or fewer. The enrollment count refers to the total number of individuals newly covered under the Medicaid expansion program, not including those who were previously eligible for Medicaid. If either condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receive European conditional marketing approval by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi receives conditional marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the EMA and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the EMA explicitly rejects the approval, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is based on the regulatory process as of October 1, 2023, and does not take into account any specific committee recommendations or decisions made after this date.

If such authorization is not granted by the resolution date, or if the EMA explicitly denies the authorization, the inquiry will be considered negative. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major diabetes medication by August 2024 and (b) Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi does not receive European conditional marketing approval by July 2024?

(a) The newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare include a major diabetes medication, confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. This must be confirmed by official announcements from Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal).
(b) Biogen's Alzheimer's treatment Leqembi does not receive conditional marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024, or the EMA explicitly rejects the approval. This must be confirmed by the absence of an official announcement by the EMA and not reported by at least two reputable news sources. 
If both (a) and (b) occur as described, the question resolves as YES. If either (a) or (b) does not occur as described, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Alibaba Group not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will Alibaba Group come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Alibaba Group successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of Alibaba Group employees (a minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The duration of the strike must be at least one week.
3. The resolution needs to be verified through official announcements from both Alibaba Group and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be covered by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution that meets all these conditions is not reached by the specified deadline, or if no major strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Large protests in Indonesia in response to religious freedom legislation, and (b) Alibaba Group not resolving a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) Alibaba Group does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation or non-resolution of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this part of the question to resolve as YES, the strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and no resolution is confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union. The non-resolution or continuation of the strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part of the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Large protests in Indonesia in response to religious freedom legislation, nor (b) Alibaba Group resolving a major workers' strike?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES only if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) There are no credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must not involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must not be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If any such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question will resolve as YES.

(b) Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the resolution of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this part of the question to resolve as YES, the strike must not involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and a resolution is confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union. The resolution of the strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, this part of the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if neither (a) nor (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be both: (a) significant demonstrations in Indonesia against new legislation on religious freedom, and (b) Alibaba Group failing to settle a major strike involving workers?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered a YES only if both of the following criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024:

(a) There are trustworthy reports from at least two prominent international news agencies (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) indicating significant demonstrations in Indonesia specifically opposing the new legislation on religious freedom. To be categorized as 'significant', the demonstrations must have at least 1,000 participants in a single event or in multiple coordinated events accumulating to a minimum of 1,000 participants throughout Indonesia. The demonstrations must be directly connected to the matter of religious freedom legislation. If no demonstrations that satisfy these conditions occur by the given date, or if the legislation is revoked prior to inciting such demonstrations, this segment of the inquiry will resolve as NO.

(b) Alibaba Group does not achieve a settlement with unionized workers, leading to the continuation or unresolved status of a notable strike by July 31, 2024. For this part of the inquiry to resolve as YES, the strike must involve a considerable number of Alibaba Group employees (at least 1,000 participants), persist for a minimum of one week, and there must be no resolution confirmed by official announcements from both Alibaba Group and the relevant union. The continuation or unresolved status of the strike must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no resolution meeting all these stipulations is reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike takes place, this part of the inquiry will resolve as NO.

The overall inquiry will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. question.title: Will the Washington Lottery offer online products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Washington Lottery has officially launched any of its products for online purchase or play. (b) The Washington Lottery does not offer online products: This requires that the Washington Lottery has not officially launched any of its products for online purchase or play. question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. The waiting period must specifically be 72 hours; longer or shorter periods do not qualify. question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly increases are reported by the resolution date, or if only one or two months show an increase, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales not increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are not three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If such consecutive monthly increases are reported by the resolution date, or if all three months show an increase, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a rise in sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. for three straight months by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by the end of July 2024, there are three successive months during which sales of previously owned homes in the United States exhibit an increase when compared to the month prior. The information must be corroborated by credible sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other respected analysts in the real estate sector. The increases should be reported using seasonally adjusted annual rates. If, by the resolution date, no such consecutive monthly increases are recorded, or if only one or two months show an increase, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major cholesterol medication by August 2024, and (b) U.S. previously occupied home sales fail to increase for three consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: (a) This part resolves as YES if the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare include a major cholesterol medication confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of the medication must be reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal. (b) This part resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are not three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. The combined question resolves as YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

Confirmation must not come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of the medication must not be reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal. (b) This part resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are three consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show an increase compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The increases must not be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. The combined question resolves as YES if neither (a) nor (b) occur as described.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the French economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the French economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by the end of July 2024, the French economy has not entered into a recession. For the purposes of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The inquiry will be deemed FALSE if the French economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%, and (b) The French economy enters a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). (b) The French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If one or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%, nor (b) The French economy enters a recession?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). (b) The French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as YES. If one or both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The preferred inflation metric of Mexico's Central Bank indicates a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%, and (b) France's economy falls into a recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation gauge shows a month-over-month increase that exceeds 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially documented by the Central Bank of Mexico or an appropriate Mexican governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero). (b) France's economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. If both criteria are met, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The French economy avoids a recession or (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: (a) The French economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024, with the increase being officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The French economy enters a recession or (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase of 0.5% or less?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: (a) The French economy does enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase of 0.5% or less in every month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024, with the increase being officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero. If at least one condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) The French economy successfully avoids a recession or (b) The preferred inflation metric of the Central Bank of Mexico experiences a monthly rise greater than 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following situations occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The French economy does not fall into recession, which is defined as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France, at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico's favored inflation indicator shows a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024, with the increase officially reported by the Central Bank of Mexico or a pertinent Mexican governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or El Financiero. If neither of these situations occurs, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will BNSF Railway reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both BNSF Railway and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will BNSF Railway not reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors do not publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must not be officially confirmed by both BNSF Railway and the union, and not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should not directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If such an agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement specifically addresses work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will BNSF Railway finalize a new contract with the conductors' union concerning predictable work schedules by August 2024?

The contract should directly deal with the matter of enhancing schedule predictability for train conductors, as highlighted in the ongoing conflict. If no such contract is finalized, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced contract does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Colorado implements a free community college plan by July 2024, and (b) BNSF Railway fails to reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Colorado implements a free community college plan by July 2024: This will be true if, by July 31, 2024, Colorado has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local Colorado newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, this part resolves as NO.

(b) BNSF Railway fails to reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024: This will be true if, by August 31, 2024, no new agreement specifically addressing work schedule predictability for conductors is publicly announced by both BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors, or if such an agreement is not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). Additionally, if an announced agreement does not specifically address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, this part will resolve as YES. If a qualifying agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, this part resolves as YES.

(b) BNSF Railway reaches a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024: This will be true if, by August 31, 2024, a new agreement specifically addressing work schedule predictability for conductors is publicly announced by both BNSF Railway and the union representing train conductors, or if such an agreement is reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). Additionally, if an announced agreement specifically addresses the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, this part will resolve as NO. If no qualifying agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, this part resolves as YES.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nicholas Collon is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points by August 2024, and (b) the World Bank does not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?

(a) At any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the World Bank does not officially announce any new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. Verification will be based on announcements made through official World Bank channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The declaration must be confirmed through official African Union announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the African Union to issue public health warnings. If such a declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union does not extend the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the African Union announce the conclusion of the current mpox epidemic by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the African Union officially states that the ongoing mpox epidemic is concluded by August 31, 2024. Such a declaration must be verified through formal announcements from the African Union or reports from a minimum of three credible news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The epidemic mentioned pertains to the situation that led the African Union to issue public health alerts. If there is no declaration to end the epidemic by the resolution date, or if the African Union prolongs the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate remains at or above 3.50%, and (2) The African Union does not declare the current mpox outbreak over?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Central Bank of South Korea's base rate is reported to be at or above 3.50% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of South Korea announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Korea Herald). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 3.50% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this condition is not met. (2) The African Union does not officially declare the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This includes situations where no declaration is made, or if the African Union extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024. If the African Union officially declares the outbreak over by the resolution date, confirmed through official announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC), this condition is not met. The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

not_P.title: Will Illinois not maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed this decision, has not reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, and has not reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will the current legal position on abortion access in Illinois remain unchanged by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not overturned or significantly modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a prevalent second-trimester procedure. The inquiry will be deemed negative if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reintroduced stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The determination will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) The HHS's rule on telehealth services is enacted, and (b) Illinois changes its legal stance on abortion access?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative means. Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If either of these conditions is not met by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) The HHS's rule on telehealth services is enacted, nor (b) Illinois changes its legal stance on abortion access?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative means. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If both of these conditions are met by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place before their deadlines: (a) The HHS implements its rule regarding telehealth services, and (b) Illinois modifies its legal position on abortion access?

The regulation must be in effect and not just proposed or awaiting approval. If neither condition is satisfied, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system not be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. If such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be reports by August 2024 indicating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is disseminating misinformation related to elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, there exist credible reports or official alerts from election officials, government entities, or trustworthy news organizations asserting that Facebook's AI content moderation system is disseminating misinformation regarding elections. For the context of this question, 'election misinformation' pertains to inaccurate or deceptive information about electoral procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Credible reports should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The reports or alerts must explicitly reference Facebook's AI system and its involvement in the distribution of election misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are made by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Mississippi hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 and (b) Facebook's AI content moderation system not be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Mississippi officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights by July 31, 2024. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws, must be officially announced by the Mississippi state government, and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (2) By August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as YES. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Mississippi hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 nor (b) Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) Mississippi does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights by July 31, 2024. The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws, must not be officially announced by the Mississippi state government, and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if neither condition (1) nor (2) is met.

question.title: Will YouTube face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will YouTube not face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube does not become subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will YouTube encounter further legal proceedings from the U.S. government before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube is subjected to new legal proceedings launched by any entity of the U.S. government. Such legal proceedings may encompass, but are not restricted to, lawsuits or regulatory measures. For these to be considered, the legal proceedings must be officially disclosed and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal proceedings must be separate from any existing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no new proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google faces additional legal actions from the U.S. government, and (b) YouTube avoids additional legal actions from the U.S. government?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity, including lawsuits or regulatory actions, officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN), distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023; and (b) YouTube does not become subject to any new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity, with no official announcements or reports by at least two major news outlets of such new legal actions, distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023.
