para_P.title: Is it possible that the U.S. Senate will approve a measure to reduce NASA's funding by over 20%, or that New York will hold a public vote on climate change policy before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if one of the following takes place by August 31, 2024: (a) The U.S. Senate endorses a measure that entails a budget cut exceeding 20% for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) in comparison to its current fiscal year budget. The approval must be documented by official Senate records and reported by at least two prominent news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). (b) New York carries out a statewide public vote specifically regarding climate change policy. This vote must be organized by the state government, and the outcomes must be disclosed by reputable news organizations or official state sources. The subject of the vote must directly pertain to climate change, proposing new initiatives or modifying existing regulations. If neither of these situations occurs by the specified deadline, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

not_P.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims not exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, does not exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the number of weekly unemployment claims in the U.S. surpass 250,000 for five straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the weekly initial unemployment claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be marked as NO if this scenario does not occur within the given timeframe. Only official statistics released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be used for resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, and (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims never exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This component will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

(b) This component will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, never exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, or (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This component will resolve as YES if the Bank of England does not officially announce a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must not be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

(b) This component will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) The Bank of England declares a reduction in interest rates by July 2024, and (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims remain below 250,000 for five straight weeks by August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will be considered YES if the Bank of England publicly announces a reduction in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be verified through official communications from the Bank of England or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press conference after a meeting. Any speculation regarding future rate reductions or unofficial comments by individual Bank of England members will not be counted for resolution. If no such official announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

(b) This part will resolve as YES if the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, do not exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any time between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is fulfilled within the given timeframe. For the purposes of resolution, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will either U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024, or will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. para_P.title: Is it possible that either the weekly jobless claims in the United States will surpass 250,000 for five straight weeks before August 2024, or that the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following scenarios takes place: (a) The weekly initial jobless claims in the U.S., as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any time leading up to August 31, 2024. Any predictions regarding future rate cuts or unofficial comments by individual members of the BoE will not be considered for resolution. If no official announcement of an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the mpox outbreak in Nigeria be declared over by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the mpox outbreak in Nigeria not be declared over by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is not officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If such a declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Nigeria's mpox outbreak be officially considered over by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is formally announced as concluded by either the nation's health officials or the World Health Organization (WHO). The announcement must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If there is no such announcement by the resolution date, or if the outbreak continues, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Congo receive mpox vaccines from WHO by August 2024 and will the mpox outbreak in Nigeria not be declared over by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, Congo is confirmed to have received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization. The confirmation must come from official statements by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must be specifically for addressing the mpox outbreak in Congo. (2) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is not officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). If the outbreak is still ongoing or no declaration is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Congo not receive mpox vaccines from WHO by August 2024 or will the mpox outbreak in Nigeria be declared over by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (1) By August 31, 2024, Congo is confirmed to have not received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization. The confirmation must come from official statements by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must be specifically for addressing the mpox outbreak in Congo. (2) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). If the outbreak is officially declared over by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization provide mpox vaccines to Congo by the end of August 2024, and will Nigeria still be experiencing the mpox outbreak without an official end declared by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) By August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that Congo has received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization. This confirmation must come from official statements issued by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The vaccines must be specifically intended for the mpox outbreak in Congo. (2) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria has not been officially declared as concluded by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO). If the outbreak continues or no declaration is made by the resolution date, this question will resolve to YES. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If either of these conditions fails to be met, the question will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either the mpox outbreak in Nigeria be declared over by July 2024, or will Congo receive mpox vaccines from the WHO by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the mpox outbreak in Nigeria is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO), with the declaration reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). (b) By August 31, 2024, Congo is confirmed to have received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization, with confirmation from official statements by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC), and the vaccines must be specifically for addressing the mpox outbreak in Congo. If neither of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither the mpox outbreak in Nigeria be declared over by July 2024, nor will Congo receive mpox vaccines from the WHO by August 2024?

(b) By August 31, 2024, Congo is confirmed to have received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization, with confirmation from official statements by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC), and the vaccines must be specifically for addressing the mpox outbreak in Congo. If at least one of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the mpox epidemic in Nigeria be officially considered over, or will the WHO have provided mpox vaccines to Congo by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By July 31, 2024, the mpox epidemic in Nigeria is officially deemed over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO), with the announcement corroborated by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). (b) By August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that Congo has received mpox vaccines from the World Health Organization, with verification from official communications by Congo's health ministry or reports from at least two credible international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC), and the vaccines must be specifically intended for combating the mpox outbreak in Congo. If neither of these situations occurs by their respective deadline dates, the inquiry will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Google not reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority do not reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must not be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should not specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such a settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will a resolution be achieved between Google and the UK data protection authority by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, a formal agreement is established between Google and the UK data protection authority concerning a penalty levied on Google for purported data protection breaches. The agreement must be validated through official declarations from either entity or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The agreement should specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such agreement is finalized or publicly acknowledged by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or incomplete agreements do not meet the criteria for an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The European Commission implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels, and (b) Google fails to reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority?
question.body:
(a) The European Commission must officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels by August 31, 2024. This implementation must be confirmed by official announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist. The tariff must specifically target solar panels manufactured in China and not be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods.

(b) Google and the UK data protection authority must not reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations by August 31, 2024. There must be no official statements from either party or reports by at least two reputable news sources confirming such a settlement. The lack of settlement should specifically relate to the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur by August 2024: (a) The European Commission does not implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels, or (b) Google reaches a settlement with the UK data protection authority?
not_P.body:
(a) The European Commission must not officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels by August 31, 2024. This implementation must not be confirmed by official announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist. The tariff must not specifically target solar panels manufactured in China and must be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods.

(b) Google and the UK data protection authority must reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations by August 31, 2024. There must be official statements from either party or reports by at least two reputable news sources confirming such a settlement. The presence of a settlement should specifically relate to the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Is it expected that by August 2024, both of the following will take place: (a) The European Commission enforces a substantial tariff on solar panels produced in China, and (b) Google does not finalize an agreement with the UK data protection authority?
para_P.body:
(a) The European Commission is required to officially enforce a tariff of 50% or more on the importation of solar panels made in China by August 31, 2024. This enforcement needs to be validated by official announcements and covered by at least two major news organizations such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist. The tariff must be specifically aimed at solar panels produced in China and should not be part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all electronic items.

(b) Google and the UK data protection authority must not come to a formal settlement regarding a penalty levied on Google for purported data protection breaches by August 31, 2024. There should be no official communications from either side or reports from at least two credible news outlets confirming such a settlement. The absence of a settlement must specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not constitute a YES outcome.

question.title: Will either Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority or the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority nor the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If either (a) or (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Google will come to an agreement with the UK's data protection authority or that the European Commission will impose a substantial tariff on solar panels made in China by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if one of the following takes place by August 31, 2024: (a) Google and the UK's data protection authority finalize a formal agreement concerning a penalty levied against Google for purported data protection breaches. This agreement must be validated by official announcements from either party or covered by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing discussions, or incomplete agreements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The European Commission officially enacts a tariff of 50% or greater on imports of solar panels produced in China. This enactment must be confirmed by official announcements from the European Commission and reported by at least two significant news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically aimed at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all electronic items. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question will be considered NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

not_P.title: Will the Bank of England not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of England declare a reduction in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as YES if the Bank of England formally declares a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be verified by official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, the inquiry will be marked as NO. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the declaration itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which is the primary instrument for monetary policy used by the Bank of England.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The German economy avoids a recession by July 2024, and (b) The Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: (a) The German economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Bank of England does not announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024, meaning no official communications such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials confirm such an announcement by the resolution date. The interest rate refers to the Bank Rate, the Bank of England's primary monetary policy tool.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) The German economy avoids a recession by July 2024, or (b) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024?
not_P.body: (a) The German economy does not avoid a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024, meaning official communications such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials confirm such an announcement by the resolution date. The interest rate refers to the Bank Rate, the Bank of England's primary monetary policy tool.

para_P.title: Are both of the following conditions likely to be met: (a) The German economy successfully sidesteps a recession by July 2024, and (b) The Bank of England refrains from declaring an interest rate reduction by August 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The German economy successfully sidesteps a recession by July 31, 2024, which means it does not undergo two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany during the period from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. (b) The Bank of England refrains from declaring an interest rate reduction that would take effect by August 31, 2024, indicating that there are no official communications, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials, confirming such an announcement by the resolution date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which is the primary monetary policy instrument of the Bank of England.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut, or (b) The German economy avoids a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) The German economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut, nor (b) The German economy avoids a recession?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) The German economy enters a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: By mid-2024, will one of the following take place: (a) An interest rate cut is declared by the Bank of England, or (b) The German economy successfully avoids a recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) The Bank of England makes an official declaration regarding an interest rate reduction that is set to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England, including press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. The actual date when the rate cut is implemented may be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the Bank of England's main instrument for monetary policy. (b) The German economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is identified as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The inquiry will be marked as NO if the German economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

not_P.title: Will no enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The lack of adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must not be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should not outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If any such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

para_P.title: Will a legally binding code of ethics for members of the U.S. Congress be put in place by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, a legally binding code of ethics specifically for members of the U.S. Congress is officially enacted by the United States government. Confirmation of the enactment must come from at least two prominent, credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be enforceable and relevant to all current Congress members. It should specify clear standards of behavior and enforcement procedures. If such a code that fulfills these requirements is not established and officially enacted by the deadline, the inquiry will be answered with NO. Please note that mere discussions or proposals regarding such a code do not suffice for a YES answer; the code must be formally enacted and enforceable.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) no enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This requires:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) By July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. This requires confirmation by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press) that no such code has been officially adopted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement.

The question will resolve as NO if either:

1. No such referendum occurs in Michigan by August 31, 2024, or a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

2. An enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established and officially adopted by July 31, 2024, meeting the specified criteria.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, nor (b) an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This requires:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) By July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. This requires confirmation by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press) that such a code has been officially adopted. The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members, outlining clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement.

The question will resolve as NO if both:

1. A such referendum occurs in Michigan by August 31, 2024, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

2. No enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members is established and officially adopted by July 31, 2024, meeting the specified criteria.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income not increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must not be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If such an increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is more than 20%, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will the quarterly net profit of Mercedes-Benz rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter from the previous year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if Mercedes-Benz announces a net profit increase exceeding 20% for any quarter relative to the same quarter of the prior year, as detailed in its official financial disclosures published by July 31, 2024. The increase must be substantiated through official company earnings reports or at least three reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is documented by the resolution date, or if the greatest reported increase is 20% or lower, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. It is important to note that this question does not focus on any specific quarter, but rather on any quarter-over-quarter evaluation within the defined period.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Canadian economy avoids a recession, and (b) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income does not increase by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must not be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met.

not_P.body:

(b) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If such an increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is more than 20%, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES only if neither condition (a) nor (b) is met.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) The Canadian economy successfully avoids a recession, and (b) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net earnings do not rise by more than 20% compared to the previous year?

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sony Corporation not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will Sony Corporation come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with YES if Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Sony Corporation employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must continue for a minimum of one week.
3. The resolution must be verified by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
4. The outcome must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such agreement that satisfies all these conditions is reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike takes place, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024 (b) Sony Corporation does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery as of August 31, 2024. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

(b) Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For the resolution to be considered valid: 
1. A strike involving a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants) does not end with an agreement by the specified date. 
2. The strike must last for at least one week if it occurs. 
3. The lack of resolution must be confirmed by the absence of official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union regarding an agreement. 
4. The lack of resolution or the absence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). 

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, the question resolves as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The United States does not maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024 (b) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery as of August 31, 2024. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is maintained at 100% or increased at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

(b) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the resolution of a significant strike by July 31, 2024, or if a significant strike does occur. For the resolution to be considered valid: 
1. A strike involving a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants) ends with an agreement by the specified date. 
2. The strike must last for at least one week if it occurs. 
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union regarding an agreement. 
4. The resolution or the occurrence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). 

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The United States keeps a 100% tariff on machinery produced in China until August 2024 (b) Sony Corporation fails to settle a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if both of the following conditions occur: 

(a) The United States continues to enforce a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery as of August 31, 2024. The presence and level of the tariff must be confirmed through official U.S. government sources (like the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely lifted at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will be answered as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are clearly labeled as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this question.

(b) Sony Corporation does not come to an agreement with unionized workers, leading to the continuation of a major strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no major strike takes place at all. For the resolution to be considered valid: 
1. A strike involving a significant number of Sony Corporation employees (at least 1,000 participants) does not conclude with an agreement by the specified date. 
2. The strike must persist for a minimum of one week if it occurs. 
3. The absence of a resolution must be confirmed by the lack of official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union regarding an agreement. 
4. The absence of a resolution or the non-occurrence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). 

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The strike must involve at least 1,000 Sony Corporation workers.
   - The strike must last for at least one week.
   - The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
   - The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce).
   - The tariff's existence must be corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times).
   If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this part.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The strike must involve at least 1,000 Sony Corporation workers.
   - The strike must last for at least one week.
   - The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
   - The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. For this part to resolve as YES:
   - The existence and rate of the tariff must not be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce).
   - The tariff's existence must not be corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times).
   If the tariff is maintained at 100% or is not removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this part.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) By July 2024, Sony Corporation puts an end to a significant workers' strike (b) The United States continues to enforce a 100% tariff on machinery imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this aspect to be deemed YES:
   - The strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 workers from Sony Corporation.
   - The strike must persist for no less than one week.
   - The settlement must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the respective union.
   - The settlement must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (for example, Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution that meets all these conditions is reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this aspect will be answered with NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to apply a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery imports. For this segment to be considered YES:
   - The existence and percentage of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government documents (such as those from the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce).
   - The tariff's presence must be confirmed by at least two respected news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times).
   If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely abolished at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this segment will be answered with NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly described as temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this segment.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate be below 13.25% in August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be below 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have remained at or above 13.25% throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank stay at or exceed 13.25% in August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Selic rate from Brazil's Central Bank is documented to be at or above 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements made by the Central Bank of Brazil or from at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). Conversely, if the rate is reported to fall below 13.25% and stays under this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024, and (b) the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate falls below 13.25% at any point in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike. (b) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. Both conditions must be satisfied for the question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Argentine agricultural workers do not remain on strike through August 2024, or (b) the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate does not fall below 13.25% at any point in August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are not on strike and have fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers are still on strike or have only partially returned to work, the condition is not met. (b) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to have not decreased below 13.25% and is at or above this level throughout August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to be below 13.25% at any point during August 2024, the condition is not met. At least one of the conditions must be satisfied for the question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sara Lee not issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee does not officially announce a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The absence of a recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. No official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. No press release from Sara Lee
3. No announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. No reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The absence of a recall must not explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If such a recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sara Lee recall its packaged meat products because of a listeria outbreak before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee publicly declares a recall of any of its packaged meat items due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be verified through at least one of the following methods:

1. An official statement on Sara Lee's website or social media platforms
2. A press announcement from Sara Lee
3. A notification from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically references a Sara Lee recall
4. Coverage from at least three major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these conditions is made by the designated date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce results in more than 10 confirmed deaths, and (b) Sara Lee does not issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. Only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

(b) Sara Lee does not officially announce a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The absence of a recall must be confirmed by the lack of any of the following sources:
   1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
   2. A press release from Sara Lee
   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur by August 2024: (a) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce results in 10 or fewer confirmed deaths, or (b) Sara Lee issues a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is not met by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are no official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must not be specifically linked to this outbreak and must include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. Only deaths not directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

(b) Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The presence of a recall must be confirmed by the presence of any of the following sources:
   1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
   2. A press release from Sara Lee
   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources
The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

If at least one condition (a) or (b) is not met by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place by August 2024: (a) the E. coli incident associated with lettuce leads to over 10 confirmed fatalities, and (b) Sara Lee refrains from recalling packaged meats due to a listeria issue?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are validated reports indicating that more than 10 deaths have been linked to the E. coli incident associated with lettuce from a particular supplier. Official validation must be sourced from reputable entities such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or comparable health organizations, and reported by at least two trustworthy news agencies. The fatalities must be specifically connected to this incident and exclude deaths from unrelated E. coli outbreaks. Only deaths directly related to this particular incident will be counted.

(b) Sara Lee does not make an official statement regarding a recall of any of its packaged meat items due to a listeria situation. The absence of a recall must be verified by the lack of any of the following sources:
   1. An official statement on Sara Lee's website or social media platforms
   2. A press release from Sara Lee
   3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically addressing a Sara Lee recall
   4. Reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official information
The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal.

If both criteria (a) and (b) are fulfilled by the designated date, the inquiry resolves as YES. If either criterion is not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

not_P.title: Will Andrew Bailey not remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024 and (2) Andrew Bailey not remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. (2) Andrew Bailey is no longer serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on or before July 31, 2024, for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term). Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is still serving as Governor by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position. If both conditions are met by their respective resolution dates, this question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?

question.title: Will a Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Arizona enacts legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024, and (b) a Texas woman's lawsuit over an abortion-related arrest does not reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the condition is not met. (2) By July 31, 2024, no publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The question resolves as YES if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement. If a settlement is officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post) by the specified date, the condition is not met. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facebook resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) Apple does not fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
