This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(b) It is not officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. The lack of confirmation must be due to the funding not covering full tuition for all physics students, or only covering tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 31, 2024: (a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, and (b) Nigeria lifts its ban on cryptocurrency transactions?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

(b) The government of Nigeria officially reverses its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions or makes changes that effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's reversal or weakening should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either or both are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Indonesian economy enter a recession by July 2024?

The outcome will be NO if the Indonesian economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing measles outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. The outbreak referred to is the one prompting heightened global public health responses. (2) The Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by Statistics Indonesia. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following events take place: (1) A significant oil spill in the Beaufort Sea caused by an attack from militants (2) The Federation Council of Russia not approving a significant economic reform proposal that Putin opposes?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if the following two criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024:

1. A verified significant oil spill occurs in the Beaufort Sea due to an assault on a tanker by a local militant group. A significant oil spill is characterized as one that is reported by at least two credible international news outlets (like Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and results in considerable ecological harm, necessitating extensive cleanup operations. The spill must be directly associated with an attack by a local militant group on a tanker in the Beaufort Sea.

2. The Federation Council of Russia does not approve any significant economic reform legislation that is clearly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. For a NO resolution to be valid:
   - The Federation Council must not pass any legislation concerning economic policies such as fiscal expenditures, taxation, or monetary matters.
   - If any legislation is passed by the Federation Council, it should not be explicitly contested by President Putin or his administration as reported by at least two prominent international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - If legislation is passed, it must not be labeled as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets regarding its potential influence on the Russian economy.

If both conditions are met by the specified deadline, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If not, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, or (b) a major oil spill occurs in the Beaufort Sea due to a militant attack?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following events occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
   - The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   - It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   - The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

(b) A confirmed major oil spill occurs in the Beaufort Sea resulting from an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker. A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Beaufort Sea.

If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, nor (b) a major oil spill occurs in the Beaufort Sea due to a militant attack?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following events occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
   - The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   - It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   - The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

(b) A confirmed major oil spill occurs in the Beaufort Sea resulting from an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker. A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Beaufort Sea.

If either of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, either (a) the Federation Council of Russia approves a significant economic reform bill that President Putin opposes, or (b) a substantial oil spill takes place in the Beaufort Sea due to an assault by militants?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if one of the following situations happens by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Federation Council of Russia approves an important economic reform bill that is clearly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. For this to be valid:
   - The bill should pertain to economic matters, such as fiscal policy, taxation, or monetary issues.
   - It must receive approval from the Federation Council, irrespective of whether it is enacted into law.
   - The opposition from President Putin or his administration needs to be reported by at least two significant international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - The news outlets must classify the bill as 'major' or 'significant' regarding its potential effects on the Russian economy.

(b) A verified major oil spill occurs in the Beaufort Sea as a result of an attack by a local militant group on a tanker. A major oil spill is characterized as one that is reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and leads to considerable environmental harm, necessitating extensive cleanup operations. The spill must be directly associated with an attack by a local militant group on a tanker in the Beaufort Sea.

If neither of these occurrences takes place by the given deadline, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within New York City's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will New York City not announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City does not officially announce plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must not come from an official source within New York City's local government and not be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should not be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will be sufficient for a NO resolution. If such an official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will there be an official announcement from New York City regarding the limitation of short-term rental units by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the New York City government publicly reveals plans or regulations intended to restrict or decrease the number of short-term rental units (like those usually found on services such as Airbnb) in the city. The announcement must originate from an official entity within New York City's local administration and be covered by at least two credible international news outlets. The regulations or plans should specifically aim to lower the availability of short-term rental units for tourists or change their operational methods. Simple discussions or proposals lacking a formal declaration will not suffice for a YES outcome. If no such official declaration is made by the specified date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The median Canadian home price reaches a new record high, and (b) New York City does not announce plans to restrict short-term rental units?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. This record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation. (b) The city government of New York City does not officially announce any plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city. No official announcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations by the resolution date. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will lead to a YES resolution for this part. If either (a) or (b) does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The median Canadian home price does not reach a new record high, or (b) New York City announces plans to restrict short-term rental units?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: (a) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada does not reach a new record high, failing to surpass any previous monthly median price on record. This record must not be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation. (b) The city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city. An official announcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations by the resolution date. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will lead to a NO resolution for this part. If both (a) and (b) occur, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The median home price in Canada hits a new all-time high, and (b) New York City does not reveal any intentions to impose restrictions on short-term rental properties?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) The median selling price of existing homes in Canada achieves a new all-time high, exceeding any prior monthly median price recorded. This new record must be validated by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other credible real estate data sources like Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price is defined as the midpoint price in the spectrum of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half for less. It is important to note that this question pertains to the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation. (b) The municipal government of New York City does not make any formal announcements regarding plans or regulations that would restrict or limit the availability of short-term rental units in the city. There must be no official declaration reported by at least two trustworthy international news outlets by the resolution date. Simply having discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will result in a YES resolution for this aspect. If either (a) or (b) fails to occur, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units or the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city, with the announcement reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions should specifically target reducing the number of short-term rentals available to tourists or altering their operation. (b) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record, confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other recognized real estate data providers. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units nor the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city, with the announcement reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions should specifically target reducing the number of short-term rentals available to tourists or altering their operation. (b) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record, confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other recognized real estate data providers. If either of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will New York City either declare intentions to limit short-term rental units or will the median price of homes in Canada hit a new all-time high?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if one of the following happens by July 31, 2024: (a) The government of New York City makes an official statement or establishes regulations that aim to restrict or decrease the number of short-term rental units available in the city, with the announcement covered by at least two credible international news outlets. The regulations should specifically focus on diminishing the availability of short-term rentals to tourists or changing how they operate. (b) The median price of homes sold in Canada reaches a new peak, exceeding any previous recorded monthly median price, as confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other reputable real estate data sources. If neither of these scenarios occurs by the resolution date, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

not_P.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index not reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Brazil's Bovespa index to hit or surpass 130,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index achieves or exceeds the 130,000 points mark. The threshold of 130,000 points is selected as a significant level that the index may have reached prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official reports from trusted financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not attain 130,000 points within this timeframe, the resolution will be NO. It is important to note that intraday highs are considered for this resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 130,000 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Central Bank of Mexico announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (2) Brazil's Bovespa index never reaches 130,000 points before September 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this condition resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy. (2) At no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, does Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index reaches 130,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points. If both conditions are satisfied, the combined question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (1) The Central Bank of Mexico does not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024, or (2) Brazil's Bovespa index reaches 130,000 points before September 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) The Central Bank of Mexico does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, this condition resolves as NO. (2) At some point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO. If at least one of these conditions is satisfied, the combined question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following two events will happen: (1) By August 2024, the Central Bank of Mexico will declare a reduction in interest rates, and (2) Brazil's Bovespa index will not touch 130,000 points prior to September 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) The Central Bank of Mexico makes an official declaration of an interest rate reduction effective by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the Bank of Mexico, which may include press releases, statements from the Governing Board, or public addresses by Bank representatives. If such a declaration is not made by the resolution date, this criterion will resolve as NO. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate cut takes effect can be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the primary monetary policy tool of the Central Bank of Mexico. (2) During the period from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index does not reach or surpass 130,000 points at any time. The 130,000 point threshold is selected as a significant value that the index may have reached before a notable decline. Verification will rely on official index reports from trustworthy financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index hits 130,000 points at any moment during this timeframe, this condition will resolve as NO. It should be noted that intraday highs are considered for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points. If both conditions are met, the overall question resolves as YES. If not, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points or the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points at any time, including intraday highs. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). (b) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. If neither of these events occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points nor the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points at any time, including intraday highs. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). (b) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. If either of these events occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index hit or surpass 130,000 points, or will the Central Bank of Mexico declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if one of the following takes place: (a) From October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index hits or exceeds 130,000 points at any moment, including during intraday peaks. Verification will rely on official index reports from trusted financial market data sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). (b) The Central Bank of Mexico formally announces a reduction in interest rates to be effective by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated by official communications from the Bank of Mexico, such as press releases, statements from the Governing Board, or public remarks from bank officials. The actual date for the implementation of the rate cut may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. If neither of these scenarios happens, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Takeda not allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively enforcing its patent. This could be through continuing to enforce its patent rights, not issuing a formal patent withdrawal, not entering into a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that prevents unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers) that indicate no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date.

para_P.title: Will Takeda permit the production of generics for its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda makes an official declaration or verification that it will permit the generic manufacturing of its gastrointestinal medication, thereby choosing not to uphold its patent. This may occur via a formal retraction of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitates unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements by the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (like Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such declaration or confirmation is issued by the specified date, or if Takeda persists in enforcing its patent rights, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The WHO declares the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024 (b) Takeda prevents generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
   2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
   3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.
   Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively continuing to enforce its patent. This could be through not withdrawing its patent, not entering a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that prevents unrestricted generic production. Confirmation of no allowance must come from the absence of official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, indicating Takeda will allow generic production, the question resolves as NO.

The question will resolve as NO if either (a) or (b) does not occur.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) The WHO does not declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024 (b) Takeda allows generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO does not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This declaration is not reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The declaration does not specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, but rather a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. The WHO makes such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
   2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that specifically addresses the East African outbreak.
   3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.
   Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively ending its patent enforcement. This could be through withdrawing its patent, entering a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows unrestricted generic production. Confirmation of allowance must come from the presence of official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is not made by the specified date, indicating Takeda will not allow generic production, the question resolves as YES.

The question will resolve as YES if either (a) or (b) occurs.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The WHO will state that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency by August 2024, and (b) Takeda will stop generic manufacturing of its gastrointestinal medication by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) publicly announces that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer regarded as a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must issue a public statement clearly indicating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This announcement must be covered by at least two major international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The announcement must specifically mention the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa, rather than a global situation regarding Rift Valley fever in general.
   The inquiry will be considered NO if:
   1. The WHO fails to make such an announcement by August 31, 2024.
   2. The WHO issues a statement about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically pertain to the East African outbreak.
   3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency designation for the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.
   Note: If the WHO has previously declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak as no longer a global emergency before the start date of this question, the resolution will still depend on the status as of August 31, 2024.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Takeda does not officially declare or verify that it will permit generic production of its gastrointestinal medication, thereby maintaining its patent rights. This could involve not retracting its patent, not engaging in a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that obstructs unrestricted generic production. Confirmation of no permission must be evident from the lack of official announcements from the company, statements from relevant regulatory authorities, or reports by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or prominent national newspapers). If such a declaration or confirmation is made by the specified date, indicating Takeda will permit generic production, the inquiry resolves as NO.

The inquiry will resolve as NO if either (a) or (b) does not take place.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024? (b) WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Takeda allowing generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 31, 2024, means that Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Takeda continues to enforce its patent rights, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The WHO declaring the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024, requires the World Health Organization (WHO) to officially declare that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.

3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

This part will resolve as NO if:

2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024 and (b) Arizona not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this condition resolves as NO. For the purpose of this condition, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023. (2) By July 31, 2024, Arizona does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. This includes scenarios where no referendum is formally announced by the Arizona state government, or if it is not verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The condition will also resolve as YES if the referendum is not open to all eligible voters in Arizona, does not focus primarily on abortion rights, is canceled, or postponed beyond July 31, 2024. If such a referendum does occur and is completed by the resolution date, this condition will resolve as NO. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The lack of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India implement a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India publicly declares a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or be reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press conference after a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual RBI officials will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Singapore announces a new exchange rate policy by August 2024 and (b) The Reserve Bank of India does not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (2) The Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed by the lack of official statements from the Reserve Bank of India and not reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) regarding an interest rate cut. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Singapore announces a new exchange rate policy by August 2024 nor (b) The Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore does not officially announce a new exchange rate policy. The announcement must not come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should not explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (2) The Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The presence of an announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) regarding an interest rate cut. If neither condition is satisfied, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) The Central Bank of Singapore reveals a new exchange rate policy by August 2024 and (b) The Reserve Bank of India refrains from announcing a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve to YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore officially discloses a new exchange rate policy. The disclosure must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Singapore, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should clearly outline the new exchange rate policy. It must be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. (2) The Reserve Bank of India does not officially declare a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The lack of an announcement must be validated by the absence of official statements from the Reserve Bank of India and not covered by at least two major financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) regarding an interest rate cut. If both criteria are met, the inquiry will resolve to YES. If either criterion is not met, the inquiry will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024 or the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. (b) The Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If neither of these announcements is made by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

(b) The Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If at least one of these announcements is made by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Reserve Bank of India will reduce interest rates by July 2024 or that the Central Bank of Singapore will implement a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The Reserve Bank of India formally declares a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by a minimum of two major financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or during a press conference after a meeting. (b) The Central Bank of Singapore officially introduces a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024. This announcement must originate from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Singapore, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should clearly outline the new exchange rate policy and must be covered by at least two prominent financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times). If neither of these announcements occurs by their respective deadlines, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, TASS). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show no monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure does not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The lack of increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, TASS). If such an increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the inflation metric favored by the Central Bank of Russia demonstrate a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the inflation metric favored by the Central Bank of Russia indicates a month-to-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 up until July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially reported by the Central Bank of Russia or an appropriate Russian governmental body and confirmed by a minimum of two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, TASS). If there is no such increase documented during this timeframe, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-to-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other time period.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Elvira Nabiullina remains as Governor of the Central Bank of Russia through July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure does not show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Elvira Nabiullina will remain as Governor of the Central Bank of Russia through July 31, 2024. This will be confirmed if she is still serving in this capacity on July 31, 2024, as verified by official announcements from the Central Bank of Russia or reports from at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg. If she is no longer in the position for any reason (including resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. Interim or acting Governor appointments will not count as her remaining in the position.

(b) The Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure will not report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This must be verified by official publications from the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or TASS. The focus is on month-over-month changes, not year-over-year or other time frames.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are satisfied.

The combined question resolves as YES only if either (a) or (b) is not satisfied.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Nigeria announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Nigeria officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Central Bank of Nigeria communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Nigeria's primary tool for monetary policy.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Nigeria not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Central Bank of Nigeria will declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if the Central Bank of Nigeria makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates set to commence by August 31, 2024. The confirmation of this declaration must come from official communications from the Central Bank of Nigeria, which may include press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate reduction takes effect may be after August 31, 2024, provided that the declaration itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the monetary policy rate, which serves as the Central Bank of Nigeria's main instrument for conducting monetary policy.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut, and (2) The Central Bank of Nigeria does not announce an interest rate cut?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) The European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect, with the announcement confirmed by official ECB communications such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by ECB officials. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate. (2) The Central Bank of Nigeria does not officially announce an interest rate cut, with confirmation from official Central Bank of Nigeria communications such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The interest rate in question refers to the monetary policy rate. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will France's weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, exceeds 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be considered.

This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, exceeds 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be considered.

(b) The Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution.

The question will resolve as NO if neither of these conditions is met by their respective deadlines.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) France's weekly jobless claims not exceed 200,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024, nor (b) the Bank of England not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body:

(a) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, does not exceed 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be considered.

(b) The Bank of England does not officially announce a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must not be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution.

The question will resolve as NO if either of these conditions is met by their respective deadlines.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen before their specified deadlines: (a) France's weekly unemployment claims surpass 200,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024, or (b) the Bank of England makes a public announcement regarding a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative (YES) if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) The weekly initial unemployment claims in France, as documented by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, go beyond 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. Only data officially published by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be taken into account.

(b) The Bank of England publicly declares a reduction in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England or reported by a minimum of two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any predictions regarding future rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual members of the BoE will not be considered for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed negative (NO) if neither of these scenarios occurs by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Tesla announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tesla officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 6% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Tesla only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 6% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Tesla make further announcements regarding layoffs exceeding the initially stated 6% before August 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) General Motors resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) Tesla refrains from announcing additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: 

1. General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:
   - The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   - The strike must last for at least one week.
   - The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
   - The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   - If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

2. Tesla does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 6% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. If Tesla only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 6% reduction without announcing new cuts, or if no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, this part resolves as YES. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) for this part to resolve as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions are met as described.

The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) for this part to resolve as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES only if neither condition is met as described.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US falls below 6.2% by August 2024 (b) LG Electronics fails to resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 6.2% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, this part of the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will not be considered as falling below 6.2%.

(b) LG Electronics does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024, or if no significant strike occurs at all. For the resolution to be considered valid:
1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The lack of resolution must be confirmed by the absence of official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union regarding an agreement.
4. The continuation or absence of a strike must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. (2) Indiana does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. This includes scenarios where the referendum is not formally announced by the Indiana state government, not verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets), not open to all eligible voters in Indiana, or not focused primarily on abortion rights. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average.
