question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, this condition is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. If no announcement is made, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this condition is met. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in France does not cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024 (b) The United Nations Development Programme announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not successfully cancel more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, this condition is met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. If an announcement is made, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, this condition is not met. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

At least one of the conditions (a) or (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) By August 2024, a significant hospital network in France will eliminate over €250 million in medical debt, and (b) The United Nations Development Programme will refrain from announcing new funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: 

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital network located in France, in partnership with a nonprofit entity, successfully forgives more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across various areas. The forgiveness must be officially declared by the hospital network or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (like Le Monde, Reuters, or major national dailies). The debt forgiveness should focus on patients deemed financially vulnerable or unable to afford payment. If the debt forgiveness is not finalized or officially acknowledged by the specified deadline, or if the amount forgiven is €250 million or less, this criterion is not met.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not make an official declaration of new funding commitments that together surpass $400 million. If no declaration is made, or if the total of new funding commitments does not go beyond $400 million, this criterion is satisfied. The announcement(s) must be conveyed through official UNDP platforms (such as their website or press releases) and reported by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must represent new projects or significant enhancements of existing initiatives, not extensions of previously announced commitments.

Both criteria (a) and (b) must be met for this inquiry to be resolved as affirmative. If either criterion is not met, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will either the UNDP announce new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024 or a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) officially announces new funding commitments totaling more than $400 million through official channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions, not continuations of previous commitments. (b) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit, cancels over €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 financially needy patients, with the cancellation announced by the hospital or reported by at least two major news outlets. If neither event occurs by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither the UNDP announce new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024 nor a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?

The commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions, not continuations of previous commitments. (b) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit, cancels over €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 financially needy patients, with the cancellation announced by the hospital or reported by at least two major news outlets. If either event occurs by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the UNDP will declare new funding pledges exceeding $400 million by July 2024 or that a significant hospital network in France will annul over €250 million in medical liabilities by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if one of the following takes place: (a) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) formally declares new funding pledges that surpass $400 million via official announcements and covered by at least two credible news organizations. These pledges should be for new projects or major expansions, not merely extensions of prior commitments. (b) By August 31, 2024, a hospital network in France, working with a nonprofit organization, forgives over €250 million in medical liabilities for a minimum of 150,000 economically disadvantaged patients, with the forgiveness either announced by the hospital or reported by at least two prominent news outlets. If neither of these scenarios occurs by the specified deadlines, the outcome of the question will be NO.

question.title: Will the National Education Association endorse Kamala Harris for president by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the National Education Association (NEA) officially endorses Kamala Harris for the presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official NEA statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the NEA endorses a different candidate, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the National Education Association not endorse Kamala Harris for president by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the National Education Association (NEA) does not officially endorse Kamala Harris for the presidential election. The endorsement must not be confirmed through official NEA statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If an endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the NEA endorses a different candidate, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris receive the endorsement of the National Education Association for the presidential election by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the National Education Association (NEA) provides an official endorsement for Kamala Harris in the presidential race. The endorsement needs to be validated through official statements from the NEA or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no endorsement occurs by the resolution date, or if the NEA chooses to endorse another candidate, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Philadelphia by August 2024 and (b) the National Education Association does not endorse Kamala Harris for president by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Philadelphia rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the National Education Association (NEA) does not officially endorse Kamala Harris for the presidential election. This could be because no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or because the NEA endorses a different candidate. If the NEA officially endorses Kamala Harris, confirmed through official NEA statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post), this part of the question resolves as NO. The combined question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) are YES.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. (b) By July 31, 2024, the National Education Association (NEA) officially endorses Kamala Harris for the presidential election. This could be because an endorsement is made by the resolution date, or because the NEA does not endorse a different candidate. If the NEA does not officially endorse Kamala Harris, confirmed through official NEA statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post), this part of the question resolves as YES. The combined question resolves as YES only if neither (a) nor (b) are YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Kamala Harris will declare her choice for running mate during a rally in Philadelphia by August 2024 and (b) the National Education Association will refrain from endorsing Kamala Harris for president by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris makes a public declaration of her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally taking place in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the event and must clearly name the person she has selected as her running mate. This event and the announcement should be verified by at least two reliable national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours following the rally. If Harris fails to announce her running mate at a Philadelphia rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made via different channels or at another venue, this part of the question will be answered as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the National Education Association (NEA) does not formally endorse Kamala Harris for the presidential race. This could occur if no endorsement is issued by the deadline, or if the NEA chooses to endorse another candidate instead. If the NEA officially backs Kamala Harris, as confirmed by official NEA announcements or reported by at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post), this part of the question will be answered as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) are answered with YES.

This endorsement must be validated through official statements from the NEA or confirmed by a minimum of two credible news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If Harris fails to announce her running mate at a Philadelphia rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement occurs through different channels or at another venue, this part will resolve as negative. The overall question will be affirmative if either part (a) or part (b) is affirmative.

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will Google not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a number of layoffs that meets or exceeds the threshold, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Confirmed layoffs that reach or exceed the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will Google terminate at least 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has officially acknowledged the termination of a minimum of 1,800 staff members as part of its restructuring plan focused on AI. Confirmation must be derived from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centered restructuring plan that was revealed in 2023. If Google acknowledges a lesser number of terminations, or if no confirmation satisfying these conditions is provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. Any partial terminations or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 staff member threshold by the resolution date will also lead to a NO conclusion.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Google lays off fewer than 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. (b) Google has confirmed the layoff of fewer than 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or if no such confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will result in a YES resolution. If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank announces an interest rate cut, nor (b) Google lays off fewer than 1,800 employees?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must not be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. (b) Google has not confirmed the layoff of fewer than 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or if no such confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will result in a NO resolution. If neither condition (a) nor (b) is met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, both: (a) The South African Reserve Bank will declare a reduction in interest rates, and (b) Google will reduce its workforce by fewer than 1,800 employees?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the following two criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) The South African Reserve Bank makes a formal declaration of a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The interest rate reduction must be an official decision from the Monetary Policy Committee and disclosed in their official statements or press conferences following a meeting. Any predictions regarding future rate cuts or unofficial remarks from individual SARB members will not be considered for resolution. If no official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the answer will be NO. (b) Google has officially acknowledged the layoff of less than 1,800 employees as part of its restructuring plan focused on AI, or if no such acknowledgment matching the original criteria is provided by the resolution date. Confirmation must come from official corporate announcements, regulatory documents, or reports by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centered restructuring plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms layoffs of 1,800 employees or more, the answer will be NO. Partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee count by the resolution date will lead to a YES conclusion. If both conditions (a) and (b) are fulfilled, the answer will be YES; otherwise, it will be NO.

The interest rate cut must be a formal resolution made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing following a meeting. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question will be answered as negative.

question.title: Will the Shanghai Composite index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

not_P.title: Will the Shanghai Composite index not reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of Korea announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, and (b) The Shanghai Composite index fails to reach 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This component will resolve as YES if the Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, this component resolves as NO.

(b) This component will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points during this period, this component resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

For the combined question to resolve as YES, both (a) and (b) must resolve as YES.

(b) This component will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points during this period, this component resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

For the combined question to resolve as YES, either (a) or (b) must resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Bank of Korea will declare a decrease in its main interest rate by August 2024, and (b) The Shanghai Composite index will not hit 4,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will be considered YES if the Bank of Korea makes a public statement regarding a decrease in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024. The statement must be officially released by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the base rate, which is the primary mechanism the Bank of Korea uses to affect the economy. A mere suggestion or speculation about potential future rate cuts does not suffice; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate decrease. If no such statement is issued by the designated date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) This part will be deemed YES if, at no time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, does the Shanghai Composite index reach or go beyond 4,000 points. The 4,000 points threshold is selected as a significant level that the index may have previously achieved before a notable decline. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trustworthy financial market data sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points during this timeframe, this part resolves as NO. Note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not need to finish at or above 4,000 points.

For the overall question to resolve as YES, both (a) and (b) must be YES.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Pennsylvania does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolves a major workers' strike and (b) Pennsylvania does not receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects?
question.body:
(a) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolves a major workers' strike: This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

(b) Pennsylvania does not receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded $300 million or less in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Pennsylvania exceeds $300 million by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' be the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' remains the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. The ranking must be based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues.

(b) It must not be confirmed that the state of Oregon has received over $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or associated projects. If both criteria are met, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Maryland holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) By July 31, 2024, Maryland officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Maryland state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Maryland-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. This includes scenarios where the announcement is not made by Harris herself during the rally, does not clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate, or the event and announcement are not confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris makes such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The announcement should explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement should not explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil does not maintain the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

Furthermore, the declaration should be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If such a declaration is not made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil continues with the existing inflation target, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the Global Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024 and will the Central Bank of Brazil not announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Global Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Global Fund channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil does not officially announce a new inflation target. If no announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as YES. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of the Philippines announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (b) Universal Studios Hollywood workers do not approve a new labor agreement by July 2024?

The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy. Confirmation of the speech must come from official announcements by the White House or reports from at least two credible news outlets. If no such speech takes place by the deadline for resolution, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Wisconsin holds a referendum on public school funding (b) President Biden does not deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Arizona?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The state of Wisconsin officially conducts a referendum regarding public school funding. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing public school funding. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Note that this part only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome. (b) President Joe Biden does not deliver a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Arizona. The absence of such a speech must be confirmed by the lack of official White House announcements and reports from at least two reputable news sources. If such a speech occurs by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur by July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Ketchikan, Alaska, vote to restrict cruise ship docking to weekdays only by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city of Ketchikan, Alaska, has held an official vote (either by city council or public referendum) on restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, and the outcome of this vote is in favor of such a restriction. The vote must be specifically about restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, not a general restriction on cruise ships. The result of the vote must be confirmed by official city announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Alaskan news outlets). If no such vote has taken place, or if a vote occurs but does not result in approval of the weekday-only restriction, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question is about the vote itself, not the implementation of the restriction.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) Large protests occur in Canada in response to environmental policy changes, and (2) Ketchikan, Alaska, does not vote to restrict cruise ship docking to weekdays only?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets of large protests in Canada specifically in response to the government's decision to change environmental policies. These protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Canada and must be explicitly linked to the issue of environmental policy changes. The result of the vote must be confirmed by official city announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The FDA issues a recall for ground ginger products due to lead contamination by July 2024 (b) Hillshire Farm does not issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?

This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground ginger products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. By August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm does not officially announce a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. This means that none of the following sources confirm a recall:
   - An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels

If no recall explicitly mentioning listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as YES.

The question resolves as NO if either of the conditions is not met.

question.title: Will Zoom lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will Zoom not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Zoom will terminate at least 1,800 jobs by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has officially acknowledged the termination of a minimum of 1,800 jobs as part of its reorganization strategy centered around AI. Such acknowledgment must be derived from formal company statements, regulatory submissions, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (including Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The job cuts must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan that was revealed in 2023. If Zoom announces a lesser number of job cuts, or if there is no confirmation that meets these stipulations by the resolution date, the inquiry will be considered negative. Any partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 job reduction benchmark by the resolution date will also lead to a negative resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) PayPal lays off at least 1,800 employees, and (b) Zoom lays off fewer than 1,800 employees, as part of their respective AI-focused reorganization plans?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met: (1) PayPal has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. (2) Zoom has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. This includes scenarios where Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Confirmation of layoffs must still come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal), and the layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If both conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) PayPal lays off at least 1,800 employees, nor (b) Zoom lays off fewer than 1,800 employees, as part of their respective AI-focused reorganization plans?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, neither of the following conditions are met: (1) PayPal has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. (2) Zoom has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. This includes scenarios where Zoom confirms a higher number of layoffs, or if confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Confirmation of layoffs must still come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal), and the layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If either of the conditions is met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) PayPal will have let go of at least 1,800 employees, and (b) Zoom will have laid off fewer than 1,800 employees, under their respective AI-driven restructuring strategies?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) PayPal has officially announced the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-driven restructuring strategy. Verification must come from official statements by the company, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-driven restructuring plan revealed in 2023. (2) Zoom has not officially disclosed the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-driven restructuring strategy. This encompasses situations where Zoom announces a lower number of layoffs, or if no announcement meeting the original requirements is made by the resolution date. Confirmation of layoffs must still come from official company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal), and the layoffs must be directly linked to the AI-driven restructuring plan introduced in 2023. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled by the resolution date, the inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will either Zoom or PayPal lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Zoom or PayPal has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of their respective AI-focused reorganization plans. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). If neither company confirms layoffs meeting these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date for either company will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will neither Zoom nor PayPal lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Zoom or PayPal will terminate at least 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, either Zoom or PayPal has officially announced the termination of a minimum of 1,800 staff members as part of their respective AI-centered restructuring strategies. If neither organization confirms terminations that satisfy these conditions by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative. Any partial terminations or gradual implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee mark by the resolution date for either organization will also lead to a negative resolution.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

not_P.title: Will the United States not maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is maintained at 100% or not removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the United States continue enforcing a full 100% tariff on textiles produced in China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, on August 31, 2024, the United States is still applying a 100% tariff on the importation of textiles manufactured in China. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be confirmed through official U.S. government channels (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Should the tariff be lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time leading up to and including August 31, 2024, the conclusion will be NO. Temporary halts or exemptions of the tariff that are explicitly designated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this inquiry.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made footwear through August 2024 AND reduce or remove the 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles before September 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on footwear is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. (2) At any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the United States reduces the tariff below 100% or completely removes it on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The change in the tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. If the 100% tariff on textiles is maintained continuously through August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. The question will resolve as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

not_P.title: Will the United States not maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made footwear through August 2024 OR not reduce or remove the 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles before September 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions is met: (1) As of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on footwear is maintained at 100% at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. (2) At any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the United States does not reduce the tariff below 100% or completely remove it on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The change in the tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition. If the 100% tariff on textiles is reduced or removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the condition will not be met. The question will resolve as NO if both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Will the United States uphold a complete 100% tariff on footwear imported from China until August 2024 AND lessen or eliminate the 100% tariff on textiles imported from China prior to September 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to enforce a 100% tariff on the importation of footwear produced in China. The existence and percentage of the tariff must be validated through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and confirmed by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on footwear is decreased below 100% or entirely lifted at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this condition will not be fulfilled. Temporary suspensions or exemptions of the tariff that are explicitly indicated to be temporary and do not result in a permanent change to the 100% rate will not influence this condition. (2) At any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the United States reduces the tariff below 100% or fully abolishes it on imports of textiles from China. The alteration in the tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently adjust the 100% rate will not affect this condition. If the 100% tariff on textiles is continuously maintained through August 31, 2024, this condition will not be fulfilled. The inquiry will be resolved as NO if either of these conditions is unmet.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on either Chinese-made textiles or footwear through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of either Chinese-made textiles or Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariffs must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on either Chinese-made textiles or Chinese-made footwear is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO for that category. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariffs that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

not_P.title: Will the United States not maintain a 100% tariff on both Chinese-made textiles and footwear through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of both Chinese-made textiles and Chinese-made footwear. The existence and rate of the tariffs must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on both Chinese-made textiles and Chinese-made footwear is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO for that category. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariffs that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. sustain a full 100% tariff on Chinese textiles or footwear until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. still enforces a full 100% tariff on imports of either textiles or footwear produced in China. The presence and percentage of the tariffs must be confirmed through official U.S. government channels (like the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and validated by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). If the tariff on either Chinese textiles or footwear is lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the result will be NO for that specific category. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariffs that are explicitly noted as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Kansas not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will a referendum concerning abortion rights take place in Kansas before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by the date of July 31, 2024, Kansas carries out an official statewide referendum that specifically addresses abortion rights. The referendum must pertain to either establishing abortion rights in the state constitution or making significant changes to the current abortion laws. For a YES determination, the Kansas state government must officially announce the referendum, and the voting process must be concluded by the specified resolution date. Additionally, the occurrence and outcomes of the referendum must be covered by at least two major, credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or prominent national newspapers). If no referendum is conducted or finalized by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. It is important to note that simply planning a future referendum that occurs after the resolution date does not meet the criteria for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights and (b) Kansas does not hold a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. (b) Kansas does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For this condition to be met, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The non-occurrence or lack of results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Michigan holds a referendum on abortion rights nor (b) Kansas holds a referendum on abortion rights?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must not be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will be met. (b) Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For this condition to be met, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence or results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is not held or completed by July 31, 2024, this condition will be met. Both conditions (a) and (b) must not be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Michigan conducts a referendum regarding abortion rights and (b) Kansas refrains from holding a referendum on abortion rights?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of these criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) Michigan officially carries out a statewide referendum concerning the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. This referendum must be formally declared by the Michigan state authorities and corroborated by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or prominent Michigan-based media). The referendum should be accessible to all eligible voters in Michigan and should primarily address abortion rights. If no such referendum takes place or is finalized by the resolution date, or if it is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition will not be satisfied. (b) Kansas does not carry out a statewide referendum specifically regarding abortion rights. This referendum must not pertain to the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly modify existing abortion regulations. For this condition to hold, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The non-occurrence or absence of results from the referendum must be reported by at least two major, credible news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is conducted or finalized by July 31, 2024, this condition will not be satisfied. Both criteria (a) and (b) must be met for this question to resolve as YES. If either criterion is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either Kansas or Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Kansas or Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. 

For Kansas: The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. It must be officially announced by the Kansas state government, with the voting process completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). Merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

For Michigan: The referendum must be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). It must be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and focus primarily on abortion rights. If the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, it will resolve as NO.

If either state completes such a referendum by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If neither state conducts a referendum by this date, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Kansas nor Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, neither Kansas nor Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. 

For Kansas: The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. It must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government, with the voting process not completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). Merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

For Michigan: The referendum must not be formally announced by the Michigan state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Michigan-based news outlets). It must not be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, it will resolve as YES.

If neither state completes such a referendum by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either state conducts a referendum by this date, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will either Kansas or Michigan conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Kansas or Michigan officially carries out a statewide vote specifically concerning abortion rights. 

For Kansas: The vote must pertain to establishing abortion rights in the state constitution or making significant changes to current abortion laws. It must be officially declared by the Kansas state government, with the voting process finalized by the resolution date. The event and its outcomes must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). Simply planning a future vote that occurs after the resolution date does not qualify for a YES answer.

For Michigan: The vote must be officially announced by the Michigan state government and confirmed by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant Michigan-based news outlets). It must be accessible to all eligible voters in Michigan and primarily focus on abortion rights. If the vote is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, it will resolve as NO.

If either state conducts such a vote by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If neither state holds a vote by this date, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

not_P.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements not enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled fewer than 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the enrollment is at least 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. para_P.title: Will at least 25,000 individuals be enrolled in Virginia's Medicaid program with work requirements by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid program, which incorporates a work requirement, has enrolled no fewer than 25,000 low-income individuals.
