question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must not be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and not reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must not be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must not be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if the Central Bank of Chile makes a public declaration regarding a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially issued by the Central Bank of Chile and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which is the main instrument used by the Central Bank of Chile to affect the economy. A simple suggestion or speculation about potential future rate reductions does not count; there needs to be a definitive announcement of an actual rate decrease. If such an announcement is not made by the given date, the inquiry will be resolved as FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024, and (b) the Central Bank of Chile not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, this part resolves as NO. (2) The Central Bank of Chile does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The resolution criteria require that no official announcement of a rate reduction is made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If there is only a hint or speculation about future rate cuts without a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction by the specified date, this part resolves as YES. The combined question resolves as YES only if both conditions are met.

question.title: Will Ohio enact and South Carolina refrain from enacting new laws modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The state of Ohio enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Ohio news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Ohio. (2) The state of South Carolina does not enact any new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. This must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local South Carolina news stations). If South Carolina enacts a new law that modifies the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Ohio not enact or South Carolina enact new laws modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?

This must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local South Carolina news stations). If Ohio enacts a new law that modifies the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will Ohio implement new legislation while South Carolina avoids implementing any new laws that change the current regulations on medical treatment for transgender youth?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the following two criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (1) Ohio passes a new statute that changes or supersedes the existing regulations concerning medical treatment for transgender youth. This must be validated through official state legislative documentation and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local news outlets in Ohio). The new statute must specifically modify the current regulations on medical care for transgender youth in Ohio. (2) South Carolina does not introduce any new legislation that alters or replaces the existing regulations on medical treatment for transgender youth. This must also be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local news stations in South Carolina). If South Carolina enacts any new law that changes the current regulations, the answer will be negative. If either of these conditions is unmet, the answer will also be negative.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the World Health Organization not declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must not be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If such a declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO does not extend the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current SARS-CoV-2 epidemic by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 epidemic has ended by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official WHO communications or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The epidemic in question is the one that led the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency designation past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bahraini health ministry confirms more than one case of polio in Manama, and (b) The World Health Organization does not declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For this to be considered confirmed:
   1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
   2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
   3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
   4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
   5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.
   If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this condition will be NO.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. This requires:
   - The absence of such a declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or lack of reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).
   - The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.
   If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will be YES.

The question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are met by the specified date.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bahraini health ministry confirms more than one case of polio in Manama, nor (b) The World Health Organization declares the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For this to be considered confirmed:
   1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
   2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
   3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
   4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
   5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.
   If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this condition will be YES.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. This requires:
   - The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).
   - The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.
   If such a declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO does not extend the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will be NO.

The question will resolve as YES only if neither condition (a) nor condition (b) is met by the specified date.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) The Bahraini health ministry verifies multiple instances of polio in Manama, and (b) The World Health Organization does not announce that the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak has ended?
para_P.body:

(a) The Bahraini health ministry formally verifies the occurrence of more than one polio case in Manama. For this verification to be accepted:

   2. The verification must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
   3. The cases must be new and distinct from any reported prior to October 1, 2023.
   4. Only cases occurring within the geographic limits of Manama will be taken into account.
   5. The specific type of polio (whether wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) is irrelevant for this question.
   If no further cases beyond the first are confirmed by the deadline, or if only one case is confirmed overall, this condition will be NO.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially state that the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is over. This necessitates:
   - The confirmation of the absence of such a declaration through official WHO announcements or the lack of reports from at least three reputable news agencies (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).
   - The outbreak in question is the one that led the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.
   If no declaration to conclude the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will be YES.

The inquiry will conclude as YES only if both criteria (a) and (b) are satisfied by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The lack of an announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and not reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The absence of a reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be no concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile declare a decrease in its main interest rate before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the Central Bank of Chile officially declares a decrease in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be made publicly by the Central Bank of Chile and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which serves as the Central Bank of Chile's primary mechanism for economic influence. Merely suggesting or speculating about potential rate cuts does not suffice; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate decrease. If no such declaration occurs by the specified date, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Brazil's monthly job growth falls below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024 (b) The Central Bank of Chile does not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazil records a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. If no official announcement of a rate reduction is made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. question.title: Will the Swiss National Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Swiss National Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official SNB communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SNB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the policy rate, which is the SNB's primary tool for monetary policy.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved with YES if the Swiss National Bank does not make an official announcement regarding an interest rate reduction to take effect by August 31, 2024. If an announcement is made by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that the actual date when the rate cut takes effect can be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the policy rate, which is the main instrument of the SNB's monetary policy.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Illinois not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024, and (b) Illinois does not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries. The health savings account requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. (b) By August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if either (a) no other state adopts such a Medicaid plan by July 31, 2024, or (b) Illinois officially announces or conducts a healthcare reform referendum by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Minnesota holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (2) Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both of the following conditions are met:

1. Minnesota officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights. This requires:

   - The referendum explicitly addresses the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results of the referendum are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

2. Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. This includes:

   - The announcement is made through other means or at a different location.

The question will resolve as NO if either:
- No such referendum occurs in Minnesota by August 31, 2024, or it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
- Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Charlotte, North Carolina, and it is confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources within 24 hours of the rally.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tennessee holds a referendum on healthcare funding by July 2024, and (b) Indiana does not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Tennessee holds a referendum on enshrining healthcare funding in its state constitution by July 31, 2024. The occurrence must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The referendum must specifically address the funding of healthcare in the state constitution. If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum does not specifically address constitutional funding of healthcare, this condition is not met.

(b) Indiana does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024. For this condition to be met, the following criteria must be satisfied:
   1. No referendum focused on abortion rights protection is officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana by the specified date.
   2. There are no public reports of such a referendum being conducted by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this condition is not met. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date qualifies for this condition being met.

The question resolves as NO if either condition (a) or condition (b) is not met.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

A recession is characterized for this question as experiencing two successive quarters of declining GDP growth, as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, through July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for its beverage products and (b) the UK economy enters a recession?
question.body: (a) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 31, 2024. This will be based on an increase compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023, confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage products in North America, this part will resolve as NO. (b) The UK economy enters a recession by July 31, 2024. This occurs if the UK experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024, as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. If the UK economy does not enter a recession by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the city of Buenos Aires make a formal declaration regarding the limitation of short-term rental properties by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the municipal authorities of Buenos Aires officially declare plans or regulations intended to limit or control the number of short-term rental properties (like those commonly found on platforms such as Airbnb) in the city. The declaration must originate from an official entity within the local government of Buenos Aires and be reported by at least two credible international news outlets. The regulations should specifically aim to decrease the availability of short-term rentals for tourists or modify their operational methods. Simply having discussions or proposals without a formal declaration will not suffice for a YES outcome. If no such official declaration is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will result in a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The People's Bank of China announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024 and (b) Buenos Aires does not announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The People's Bank of China publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate (specifically the loan prime rate) by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the People's Bank of China and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. (2) By July 31, 2024, the city government of Buenos Aires does not officially announce plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Buenos Aires's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The People's Bank of China announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024 nor (b) Buenos Aires announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) The People's Bank of China publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate (specifically the loan prime rate) by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the People's Bank of China and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The announcement must come from an official source within Buenos Aires's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement must originate from an official entity within Buenos Aires's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If either criterion is not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Florida state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Florida not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the Florida state government.
2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. A referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Florida regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be affirmed with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the Florida state authorities.
2. The vote must directly concern the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcome of the vote must be disclosed through official state communications or reputable news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. An intended public vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the mentioned date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically aim to establish protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry solely focuses on the occurrence of the public vote within the designated timeframe, not its result.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) New Jersey holds a referendum on police reform by July 2024 (b) Florida does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. New Jersey officially conducts a referendum regarding police reform by July 31, 2024. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing police reform. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this condition is not met.

2. Florida does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. This condition is met if:
   - No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   - A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   - A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   
   This condition is not met if:
   - The referendum is officially announced and conducted by the Florida state government.
   - The referendum explicitly addresses the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results of the referendum are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if either of the above conditions is not satisfied.

not_P.body:

The question will resolve as NO if both of the above conditions are satisfied.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 7.0% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 7.0%, not merely equal it.

not_P.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage not exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not exceed 7.0%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate exceeds 7.0% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 7.0%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 30-year home loan surpass 7.0% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time in August 2024, the typical interest rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 7.0%. The rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not go beyond 7.0% at any time during August 2024, the answer will be NO. To clarify, the rate must exceed 7.0%, not just match it.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Massachusetts maintains its $15 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024, and (b) the average rate on a 30-year mortgage does not exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Massachusetts maintains its $15 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024: This resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Massachusetts remains at $15 per hour or higher, confirmed through official Massachusetts state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $15 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. 'Fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Massachusetts state law.

(b) The average rate on a 30-year mortgage does not exceed 7.0% by August 2024: This resolves as YES if the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not exceed 7.0% at any point during August 2024. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate exceeds 7.0% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. The rate must not surpass 7.0%, it can be equal to or less than it.

The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the South Korean economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can South Korea steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy has not fallen into a recession. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP as reported by Statistics Korea. Conversely, the inquiry will be deemed negative if the South Korean economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of declining GDP at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024, and (b) the South Korean economy enters a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024. This requires:
   - A public announcement by the WHO explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
   - The declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.
   - Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. The South Korean economy enters a recession by July 31, 2024, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The recession must occur at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of the conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) the WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024, nor (b) the South Korean economy enters a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. The WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024. This requires:
   - A public announcement by the WHO explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
   - The declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.
   - Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. The South Korean economy enters a recession by July 31, 2024, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The recession must occur at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of the conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) by August 2024, the WHO will announce that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency, and (b) the South Korean economy will experience a recession by July 2024?

2. The South Korean economy must enter a recession by July 31, 2024, which is defined as experiencing two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. This recession must take place at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The question will be answered with NO if one or both of the conditions are not satisfied.

question.title: Will either the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024, or will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:

para_P.title: Is it possible for the South Korean economy to steer clear of a recession by July 2024, or for the WHO to announce that the Lassa fever crisis in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency by August 2024?

question.title: Will a new AI platform be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the new AI platform and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Indiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in San Francisco, and (2) Indiana's near-total abortion ban is declared unconstitutional?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: 

(1) Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Francisco, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a San Francisco rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, this condition will not be met.

(2) A court ruling confirms the unconstitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Indiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is declared constitutional by the specified date, this condition will not be met. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of the conditions are not met by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

not_P.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index not reach 4,000 points by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. para_P.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index hit or surpass 4,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, at any moment from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index hits or surpasses 4,000 points. The 4,000 point mark is selected as a significant threshold that the index may have reached prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trusted financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index fails to reach 4,000 points during this interval, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that intraday peaks are included for resolution; the index does not have to finish at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the WHO declares the current bird flu outbreak over and (b) the Singapore Straits Times Index fails to reach 4,000 points?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will resolve as NO. (b) At no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, does the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. The question resolves as NO if either condition is not met.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. (b) At some point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach or exceed 4,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as YES. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. The question resolves as YES if both conditions are not met.

This statement must be validated through official WHO communications or reports from a minimum of three credible news organizations such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If neither event takes place by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.
